Scio ubi habitas, ubi seeds est satanae, et tenes nomen meum, et non negasti
fidem meam. Et in diebus illis Antipas testis meus fidelis, qui occisus est
apud uos, ubi satanas habitat. Sed habeo aduersus te pauca, quia habes illic
tenentes doctrinam Balaam, qui docebat in Balac mittere scandalum coram filiis
Israel, edere et fornicari: ita habes et tu tenentes doctrinam Nicolaitarum.
Similiter poenite^tia^ age: si quo minus ueniam tibi cito and pugnabo cum illis
in gladio oris mei. Qui habet aurem, audiat quid spiritus dicat ecclesiis:
Vincenti dabo manna absco^ditum, and dabo illi calculum candidum, and in
calculo nomen nouum scriptum, quod nemo scit, nisi qui accipit. Et angelo
Thyatirae ecclesiae scribe: Haec dicit filius Dei, qui habet oculos ta^qua^
flamma^ ignis, and pedes eius similes aurichalco. Noui opera tua, and fidem,
and charitatem tuam, and ministerium, and patientiam tua^, and opera tua
nouissima plura prioribus. Sed habeo aduersus te pauca, quia permittis muliere^
Hiezabel, quae sedicit propheten, docere, and seducere seruos meos, fornicari,
and manducare de idolothytis. Et dedi illi tempus ut poenitentiam ageret, and
non uult poenitere a fornicatione sua. Ecce, ego mitto eam in lectum, and qui
moecha^tur cum ea, in tribulatione maxima erunt, nisi poenitentiam ab operibus
suis egerint, and filios eius interficiam in morte, and scie^t omnes ecclesiae,
quia ego su^ scrutans renes and corda, and daba unicuique uestru^ secu^dum
opera sua. Vobis autem dico and caeteris qui Thyatirae estis. Quicunque no^
habent doctrinam hanc, and qui non cognoueru^t altitudiuem satanae, quemadmodum
dicunt: non mittam super uos aliud pondus: tamen id quod habetis, tenete donec
ueniam. Et qui uicerit, and custodierit usque in fine^ opera mea, dabo illi
potestate^ super gentes, and reget eas in uirga ferrea, and tanquam uas figuli
confringentur, sicut and ego accepi a patre meo, and dabo illi stellam
matutinam. Qui habet aurem, audiat quid spiritus dicat ecclesiis.

CAPVT III.
ET angelo ecclesiae Sardis, scribe: Haec dicit qui habet septem spiritus Dei,
and septem stellas: Scio opera tua, quia nomen habes quod uiuas, and mortuus
es. Esto uigilans, and confirma caetera quae moritura erant: Non enim inueni
opera tua plena coram Deo meo. In mente ergo habe, qualiter acceperis, and
audieris, and serua, and poenitentiam age. Si ergo non uigilaueris, ueniam ad
te tanquam fur, and nescies qua hora ueniam adte. Sed habes pauca nomina in
Sardis, qui non inquinauerunt uestimenta sua, and ambulabunt mecum in albis,
quia digni sunt. Qui uicerit, sic uestietur uestimentis albis, and non delebo
nomen eius de libro uitae, and confirebor nomen eius coram patre meo, and coram
angelis eius. Qui habet aurem, audiat quid spiritus dicat ecclesiis. Et angelo
Philadelphiae ecclesiae scribe: Haec dicit sanctus et uerus qui habet clauem
David, qui aperit, et nemo claudit: claudit, et nemo aperit. Scio opera tua.
Ecce, dedi coram te ostium apertum, quod nemo potest claudere, quia modicam
habes uirtutem, and seruasti uerbum meum, and non negasti nomen meum. Ecce,
dabo de synagoga satanae, qui dicunt se Iudaeos esse, and non sunt, sed
mentiuntur. Ecce, faciam illos ut ueniant, and adorent ante pedes tuos, and
scient quia ego dilexi te. Quoniam seruasti uerbum patientiae meae, and ego
seruabo te ab hora tentationis, quae uentura est in orbem uniuersum, tentare
habitantes in terra. Ecce uenio cito, tene quod habes, ut nemo accipiat coronam
tuam. Qui uicerit, faciam illum columnam in templo Dei mei, and for as non
egredietur amplius, and scribam super eum nomen Dei mei, and nomen ciuitatis
Dei mei nouae Jerusalem, quae descendit de coelo a Deo meo, and nomen meum
nouum. Qui habet aurem, audiat quid spiritus dicat ecclesiis. Et angelo
Laodiciae ecclesiae, scribe: Haec dicit Amen, testis fidelis and uerus, qui est
principium creaturae Dei: Scio opera tua, quod neque frigidus es, neque
calidus: utinam frigidus esses aut calidus. Sed quia tepidus e^, and nec
frigidus, nec calidus, incipiam te euomere ex ore meo, qa dicis: Dives sum, and
locu pletatus, and nullius egeo: and nescis qa tu es miser, and miserabilis,
and pauper, and caecus, and nudus. Suadeo tibi emere a me aurum ignitum
probatum, ut locuples fias, and uestimentis albis induaris, ut non appareat
confusio nuditatis tuae: and collyrio inunge oculos tuos, ut uideas. Ego quos
amo, arguo, and castigo. Aemulalare ergo, and poenitentiam age. Ecce sto ad
ostium, and pulso: si quis audierit uocem meam, and aperuerit mihi ianuam,
introibo ad illum, and coenabo cum illo, and ipse mecum. Qui uicerit, dabo ei
sedere mecu^ in throno meo, sicut and ego uici, and consedicum patre meo in
throno eius. Qui habet aurem, audiat quid spiritus dicat ecclesiis.

CAPVT IIII.
POst haec uidi, and ecce ostium apertum in coelo, and uox prima quam audiui
tanquam tubae loquentis mecum, dicens: Ascend huc, and ostendam tibi quae
oportet fieri cito. Post haec, statim fui in spiritu. Et ecce seeds posita erat
in coelo, and supra sedem sedens. Et qui sedebat, similis erat aspectui lapidis
Iapsidis and Sardinis, and iris erat in circuitu sedis, similis uisioni
Smaragdinae. Et in circuitu sedis, sedilia uiginti quatuor, and suprathronos
uiginti quatuor seniores sedentes, circumamicti stolis albis, and in capitibus
suis coronae aureae. Et de throno procedeba^t fulgura, and uoces, and tonitrua,
and septem lampades ardentes ante thronum, quae sunt septe^ spiritus Dei. Et in
conspectu sedis, tanquam mare uitreum, simile Cristallo, and in medio sedis,
and in circuitu sedis quatuor animalia plena oculis ante and retro. Et animal
primum simile leoni, and secu^du^ simile uitulo, and tertiu^ animal habe^s
faciem uelut hominis, and quartu^ animal simile aquilae uolanti. Et quatuor
animalia singula eorum habebant alas senas, and in circuitu, and intus plena
sunt oculis, and requiem non habeba^t die ac nocte, dicentia: Sanctus, sanctus,
sanctus Dominus Deus omnipotens, qui erat, et qui est, et qui ue^turus est. Et
cum darent illa animalia gloria^, et honore^, et benedictionem sedenti super
thronu^, uiuenti in secula seculoru^, procedebant uiginti quatuor seniores ante
sedente^ in throno, et adorabant uiuentem in secula seculoru^, and mittebant
coronas suas ante thronu^ dice^tes: Dignus es domine Deus noster accipere
gloriam et honore^ et uirtute^: quia tucreasti oi^a, et propter uoluntate^ tua^
era^t, et creata su^t.

CAPVT V.
ET uidi in dextera sede^tis super thronu^, libru^ scriptu^ intus et foris,
signatu^ sigillis septe^. Et uidi angelu^ forte^, et praedica^tem uoce magna:
Quis est dignus aperire librum, et soluere signacula eius? Et nemo poterat
neque in coelo, neque in terra, neque subtus terram, aperiro librum, neque
respicere illum. Et ego flebam multum, quoniam nemo dignus inue^tus est aperire
librum, nec uidere eum. Et unus de senioribus dixit mihi: Ne fleueris, ecce,
uicit leo de tribu Judah, radix David aperire librum, and soluere septem
signacula eius. Et uidi, and ecce in medio throni and quatuor animalium, and in
medio seniorum agnum stantem tanquam occisum, habentem cornua septem, and
oculos septem, qui sunt septem spiritus Dei, missi in omnem terram. Et uenit,
and accepit de dextera sedentis in throno libru^. Et cum aperuisset librum,
quatuor animalia, and uiginti quatuor seniores ceciderunt coram agno, habentes
singuli citharas and phialas aureas, plenas odoramentorum, quae sunt orationes
sanctorum, and cantabant canticum nouu^ dicentes: Dignus es Domine accipere
librum, and aperire signacula eius, quoniam occisus es, and redemisti nos Deo
in sanguine tuo, ex o^ni tribu, and li^gua, and populo, and natione, and
fecisti nos deo nr^o regnu^, and sacerdotes, and regnabimus superterra^. Et
uidi, and audiui uoce^ a^geloru^ multoru^ i^ circuitu throni, and ai^aliu^ and
senioru^, and erat numerus eoru^ milia miliu^ dice^tiu^ uoce magna: Dignus est
agnus quod occisus est accipere uirtute^ and diuinitate^, and sapientia^, and
fortitudine^, and honore^, and gloria^, and benedictione^. Et omnem creaturam
quae in coelo est, and sub terra, and quae sunt in mari, and quae in eo, omnes
audiui dicentes: Sedenti in throno, and agno, benedictio, and honor, and
gloria, and potestas in secula seculorum. Et quatuor animalia dicebant: Amen.
Et uiginti quatuor seniores ceciderunt in facies suas, and adorauerunt uiuentem
in secula seculorum.

CAPVT VI.
ET uidi quod aperuisset agnus unum de septem sigillis, and audiui unum de
quatuor animalibus dicens tanquam uocem tonitrui: Veni, and uide. Et uidi: and
ecce equus albus, and qui sedebat super illum, habebat arcum, and data est ei
corona, and exiuit uincens ut uinceret. Et cum aperuisset sigillum secundum,
audiui secundum animal, dice^s: Veni and uide. Et exiuit alius equus, rufus,
and qui sedebat super illum, datum est ei ut sumeret pacem de terra, and ut
inuicem se interficiant, and datus est ei gladius magnus. Et cum aperuisset
sigillum tertium, audiui tertium animal, dicens: Veni and uide. Et ecce equus
niger, et qui sedebat super illum habebat stateram in manu sua. Et audiui
tanquam uoce^ in medio quatuor animaliu^, dice^te^: Bilibris tritici denario
uno, et tres bilibres hordei denario uno, and uinum, and oleum no laeseris. Et
cum aperuisset sigillum quartum, audiui uocem quarti animalis, dicentis: Veni
et uide. Et ecce equus pallidus, et qui se debat super eu^, nome^ illi Mors, et
infernus sequebatur eum, et data est illi potestas super quatuor parts terrae,
interficere gladio, fame, et morte, et bestiis terrae. Et cum aperuisset
sigillum quintum, uidi subtus altar animas interfectorum propter uerbum Dei,
et propter testimonium quod habebant, et clamabant ^oce magna, dicentes:
Vsquequo Domine, sanctus et uerus non iudicas, et non uindicas sanguinem
nostrum de his qui habitant in terra? Et datae sunt illis singulae stolae
albae, et dictum est illis ut requiescerent adhuc te^pus modicu^, donec
co^plea^tur co^serui eoru^ and fr^es eoru^, qui interficiendi sunt sicut et
illi. Et uidi cum aperuisset sigillum sextum, et ecce terraemotus magnus factus
est, et sol factus est niger tanquam saccus silicinus: et luna tota facta est
sicut sanguis, et stellae de coelo ceciderunt super terram, sicut ficus emittit
grossos suos cum a ue^to magno mouetur: and coelu^ recessit sicut liber
inuolutus, and o^nis mo^s, et insulae de locis suis motae sunt: et reges
terrae, et principes, et tribuni, et diuites, et fortes, et omnis seruus, et
liber absconderunt se in spelu^cis and petris montium, et dicunt montibus et
petris: Cadite super nos, et abscondite nos a facie sedentis super thronum, et
ab ira agni: quoniam uenit dies magnus irae ipsorum. Et quis poterit stare?

CAPVT VII.
POst haec uidi quatuor angelos stantes super quatuor angulos terrae, tenentes
quatuor uentos terrae, ne flarent super terram, neque super mare, neque in
ullam arborem. Et uidi alterum angelum ascendentem ab ortu solis, habentem
signum Dei uiui, et clamauit uoce magna quatuor angelis, quibus datum est
nocere terrae and mari, dicens: Nolite nocere terrae et mari, neque arboribus,
quoadusque signemus seruos Dei nostri in frontibus suis. Et audiui numerum
signatorum, centum quadraginta quatuor milia, signati ex omni tribu filiorum
Israel. Ex tribu Judah, duodecim milia signati. Ex tribu Ruben, duodecim milia
signati. Ex tribu Gad, duodecim milia signati. Ex tribu Aser, duodecim milia
signati. Ex tribu Nephthalim, duodecim milia signati. Ex tribu Manasse,
duodecim milia signati. Ex tribu Symeo^ duodeci^ milia signati. Ex tribu Leui*
duodeci^ milia signati. (...) mons magnus igne ardens, missus est in mare, et
facta est tertia pars maris, sanguis, et mortua est tertia pars creaturae,
eorum quae habebant animas in mari, et tertia pars nauium interiit. Et tertius
angelus tuba cecinit, et cecidit de coelo stella magna ardens tanquam facula,
et eecidit in tertiam partem fluminum, et in fontes aquarum: et nomen stellae
dicitur Absynthium, et facta est tertia pars aquarum in absynthium, et multi
hominum mortui sunt de aquis: quia amarae factae sunt. Et quartus angelus tuba
cecinit, et percussa est tertia pars solis, et tertia pars lunae, et tertia
pars stellarum, ita ut obscuraretur tertia pars eorum, et diei non luceret pars
tertia, et noctis similiter. Et uidi, et audiui uocem unius aquilae uolantis
per medium coeli, dicentis uoce magna: Vae, uae, uae, habitantibus in terra, de
caeteris uocibus triu^ angelorum, qui erant tuba canituri.

CAPVT IX.
ET quintus angelus tuba cecinit, et uidi stellam de coelo cecidisse in terram,
et data est ei clauis putei abyssi. Et aperuit puteum abyssi, et ascendit fumus
putei, sicut fumus fornacis magnae: et obscuratus est sol, et aer de fumo
putei. Et de fumo putei exierunt locustae in terram, and data est illis
potestas, sicut habent potestatem scorpiones terrae, and praeceptum est illis
ne lederent foenum terrae, neque omne uiride, neque omnem arborem: nisi tantum
homines, qui non habent signum Dei in frontibus suis: and dictum est illis, ne
occiderent eos, sed ut crucia^ent mensibus quinque: and crucia^us eorum, ut
cruciatus scorpii cum percutit hominem. Et in diebus illis quaerent homines
mortem, et non inuenient eam: and desyderabunt mori, et fugiet mors ab eis. Et
similitudines locustaru^ similes equis paratis in praelium: et super capita
earum tanquam coronae similes auro, and facies earum tanquam facies hominum: et
habeba^t capillos sicut capillos mulieru^, et de^tes earu^ sicut de^tes leonu^
era^t: et habeba^t loricas sicut loricas ferreas, et uox alarm earum sicut uox
curruum equorum multorum currentium in bellum: et habebant caudas similes
scorpionum, et aculei erant in caudis earum: et potestas earum nocere hominibus
mensibus quinque. Et habebant super se regem angelum abyssi, cui nomen hebraice
Abaddon, graece autem Appollyon, and latin habens nomen Exterminans. Vae unum
abiit, and ecce ueniunt adhuc duo uae post hec. Et sextus angelus tuba cecinit,
et audiui uocem unam ex quatuor cornibus altaris aurei, quod est ante oculos
Dei, dicentem sexto angelo qui habebat tubam: Solue quatuor angelos, qui ligati
sunt in flumine magno Euphrate. Et soluti sunt quatuor angeli, qui parati era^t
in horam, and diem, and me^sem, and annum, ut ociciderent tertia^ partem
hominu^. Et numerus equestris exercitus, uicies millies dena milia. Et audiui
numeru^ eoru^. Et ita uidi equos in uisione, and quam sedeba^t super eos,
habebant loricas igneas, and hyacinthinas, and sulphureas: and capita equoru^
erant tanquam capita leonum, and de ore eoru^ procedebat ignis, and fumus, and
sulphur. Et ab his tribus plagis occisa est tertia pars hoi^m, de igne, and de
fumo, and sulphur, quae procedeba^t ex ore ipsoru^. Potestas em^ equorum in
ore eoru^ est, and in caudis eoru^: na^ caudae eoru^ similes serpe^tibus,
habe^tes capita, and in his noce^t. Et caeteri hoi^es qui no^ su^t occisi in
his plagis, neque poenitentia^ egerunt de operibus manuum suaru^, ut non
adorare^t daemonia, and simulachra aurea, and argentea, and aerea, and lapidea,
and lignea, quae neque uidere possu^t, neque audire, neque ambulare, and no^
egeru^t poenite^tia^ ab homicidiis suis, neque a ueneficiis suis, neque a
fornicatio^e sua, neque a furtis suis.

CAPVT X.
ET uidi alium angelum fortem descendentem de coelo, amictum nube, et iris in
capite eius, and facies eius erat ut sol, and pedes eius tanquam columna ignis:
and habebat in manu sua libellum apertum. Et posuit pede^ suum dexterum super
mare, sinistrum autem super taerram, and clamauit uoce magna, quemadmodum cum
ieo rugit. Et cum clamasset, locuta sunt septem tonitrua uoces suas. Et cum
locuta fuissent septem tonitrua uoces suas, ego scripturus eram: and audiui
uocem de coelo, dicentem mihi: Signa quae locuta sunt septem tonitrua, and noli
ea scribere. Et angelus quem uidi stantem super mare and super terram, leuauit
manum suam ad coelum, and iurauit per uiuentem in secula secula seculoru^, qui
creauit coelu^, and ea quae in eo su^t: and terra^, and ea quae in ea sunt: and
mare, and ea quae in eo su^t: Quia te^pus no^ erit amplius, sed in diebus uocis
septimi angeli, cu^ coeperit tuba canere, consu^mabitur mysteriu^ Dei, sicut
eua^gelizauit per seruos suos prophetas. Et audiui uoce^ de coelo, iterum
loque^tem mecu^ and dicentem: Vade, and accipe librum apertum de manu angeli
stantis super mare et super terram. Et abii ad angelum, dicens ei, ut daret
mihi librum. Et dixit mihi: Accipe librum, and deuora illum, and faciet
amaricari uentrem tuum, sed in ore tuo erit dulce tanquam mel. Et accepi libru^
de manu angeli, and deuoraui illum, and erat in ore meo tanquam mel dulce: and
cum deuorassem eum, amaricatus est uenter meus, et dixit mihi: Oportet te
iterum prophetare Ge^tibus, and populis, and linguis, and regibus multis.

CAPVT XI.
ET datus est mihi calamus similis uirgae, and dictum est mihi: Surge, and
metire templu^ Dei, and altate, and adorantes in eo: atrium autem quod est
intra templum, eiice for as, and ne metiaris illud: quoniam datum est Gentibus,
and ciuitatem sanctam calcabunt mensibus quadraginta duobus. Et dabo duobus
testibus meis, and prophetabu^t diebus mill ducentis sexaginta, amicti saccis.
Hi sunt duae oliuae, and duo candelabra lucentia, in conspectu Domini terrae
stantia. Et si quis uoluerit eos nocere, ignis exiet de ore eorum, and
deuorabit inimicos eorum: and si quis uoluerit eos laedere, sic oportet eum
ocdi. Hi habent potestatem claudendi coelum, ne pluat diebus prophetiae
ipsorum: and potestatem habent super aquas conuertendi eas in sanguinem, et
percutere terram omni plaga quotiescunque uoluerint. Et cum finierint
testimonium suum, bestia quae ascendit de abysso, faciet aduersum eos bellum,
and uincet illos, and occidet eos. Et corpora eorum iacebunt in plateis
ciuitatis magnae, quae uocatur spu^aliter Sodoma, and Aegyptus, ubi and Dn^s
eorum crucifixus est. Et uidebunt de tribubus, and populis, and linguis, and
gentibus corpora eoru^ per tres dies and dimidiu^, and corpora eorum no^ sinent
poni in monume^tis. Et inhabita^tes terram gaudebunt super illis, and
iucundabuntur, and munera mittent inuicem: quoniam hi duo prophetae
cruciauerunt eos, qui habitabant super terram. Et post dies tres and dimidium,
spiritus uitae a Deo intrauit in eos: and steterunt super pedes suos* and timor
magnus cecidit super eos qui uiderunt eos. Et audierunt uocem magnam de coelo,
dicentem eis: Ascendite huc. Et ascenderunt in coelum in nube, and uiderunt
illos inimici eorum. Et in illa hora factus est terraemotus magnus, and decima
pars ciuitatis cecidit, and occisa sunt in terrae motu nomina hominum septem
milia, and reliqui in timorem sunt missi, and dederunt gloria^ Deo coeli. Vae
secundum abiit, and ecce uae tertium ueniet cito. Et septimus angelus tuba
ceciuit, and factae su^t noces magnae in coelo, dicentes: Factum est regnum
huius mundi Domini nostri and Christi eius, and regnabit in secula seculorum.
Amen. Et uiginti quatuor seniores qui in co^spectu Dei sedent in sedibus suis,
cecideru^t in facies suas, and adoraueru^t deu^, dice^tes: Gratias agimus tibi
Dn^e Deus noster oi^pote^s, q es, and q eras, and qui ue^turus es, qa accepisti
uirtute^ tua^ magna^, and regnasti. Et iratae sunt ge^tes, and aduenit ira tua,
and tempus mortuorum iudicari, and reddere mercede^ seruis tuis prophetis, and
sanctis, and timentibus nomen tuum pusillis and magnis, and extermina^di eos
qui corruperunt terra^. Et apertum est te^plum Dei in coelo, and u^sa est arca
testamenti eius in templo eius, and facta sunt fulgura, and uoces, and
tonitrua, and terraemotus, and grando magna.

CAPVT XII.
ET signum magnum apparuit in coelo: Mulier amicta sole, and luna sub pedibus
eius, and in capite eius corona stellaru^ duodecim, and in utero habens, and
clamat parturie^s, and cruciatur ut pariat. Et uisum est aliud signum in coelo:
and ecce draco magnus rufus, habe^s capita septe^, and cornua december, and in
capitibus eius diademata septe^, and cauda eius trahebat tertia^ parte^
stellaru^ coeli, and misit eas in terra^. Et draco stetit ante muliere^ quae
erat paritura, ut cu^ peperisset, filiu^ eius deuoraret. Et peperit filiu^
masculu^, qui recturus erat oe^s ge^tes in uitga ferrea, and raptus est filius
eius ad deu^, and ad thronu^ eius, and mulier fugit in solitudine^, ubi habebat
locu^ paratu^ a deo, ut ibi pascat ea^ diebus mill, ducentis, sexagi^ta. Et
factu^ est praeliu^ magnu^ in caelo: Michael and angeli eius praeliabantur cu^
dracone, et draco pugnabat and angeli eius, et non ualuerunt, neque locus
inuentus est eoru^ amplius in coelo. Et proiectus est draco ille magnus,
serpens antiqu^s, qui uocatur diabolus et satanas, qui seducit uniuersum orbe^,
et proiectus est in terram, et angeli eius cum illo missi sunt. Et audiui uocem
magnam in coelo dicentem: Nunc facta est salus, et uirtus, et regnum Dei
nostri, et potestas Christi eius, quia proiectus est accusator fratrum
nostrorum, qui accusabat illos ante co^spectum Dei nostri die ac nocte. Et ipsi
uicerunt eum propter sanguinem agni, et propter uerbum testimonii sui, et non
dilexerunt animas suas usque ad mortem: propterea laetamini coeli, and qui
habitatis in eis. Vae terrae et mari, quia descendit diabolus ad uos, habens
iram magnam, sciens quod modicum tempus habet. Et postquam uidit draco quod
proiectus esset in terram, persecutus est mulierem quae peperit masculum: et
datae sunt mulieri alae duae aquilae magnae, ut uolaret in desertum in locum
suum, ubi alitur per tempus et tempora, et dimidium temporis a facie serpentis.
Et misit serpens ex ore suo post mulierem aqua^ tanquam flumen, ut eam faceret
trahi a flumine. Et adiuuit terra mulierem, et aperuit terra os suum, et
absorbuit flumen, quod misit draco de ore suo. Et iratus est draco in mulierem,
and abiit facere praelium cum reliquis de semine eius qui custodiunt mandata
Dei, et habe^t testimonium IESV Christi. Et stetit supra arenam matis.

CAPVT XIII.
ET uidi de mari bestia^ ascendentem, habentem capita septem, et cornua december,
and super cornua eius december diademata, and super capita eius nomina
blasphemiae. Et bestia quam uidi, similis erat pardo, and pedes eius sicut
pedes ursi, and os eius sicut os leonis. Et dedit illi draco uirtutem sua^ and
potestatem magnam. Et uidi unum de capitibus suis, quasi occisum in mortem, and
plaga mortis eius curata est. Et admirata est uniuersa terra post bestiam, and
adorauerunt draconem qui dedit potestatem bestiae, and adorauerunt bestiam,
dicentes: Quis similis bestiae? et quis poterit pugnare cum ea? Et datu^ est ei
os loquens magna et blasphemias: and data est ei potestas facere menses
quadraginta duos. Et aperuit os fuum in blasphemias ad Deum, ut blasphemaret
nomen eius, and tabernaculum eius, and eos qui in coelo habita^t: and datu^ est
illi bellum facere cum sanctis, and uincere eos. Et data est illi potestas in
omnem tribum, et populum, et linguam, et gentem, et adorauerunt eam omnes qui
inhabitabant terra^, quorum no^ sunt scripta nomina in libro uitae agni, qui
occisus est ab origin mundi. Si quis habet aurem, audiat: Qui in captiuitatem
duxerit, in captiuitatem uadet: qui in gladio occiderit, oportet eum gladio
occidi. Hic est patientia et fides sanctorum. Et uidi aliam bestiam ascendentem
de terra, and habebat cornua duo similia agni, et loquebatur sicut draco. Et
potestatem prioris bestiae omnem faciebat in conspectu eius, et fecit terram et
habitantes in ea adorare bestiam primam, cuius curata est plaga mortis. Et
fecit signa magna, ut etiam ignem faceret de coelo descendere in terram in
conspectu hominum. Et seduxit habitantes in terra propter signa quae data sunt
illi facere in conspectu bestiae, dicens habitantibus in terra: ut faciant
imaginem bestiae, quae habet plagam gladii, et uixit. Et datu^ est illi ut
daret spiritum imagini bestiae, et ut loquatur imago bestiae, et faciet ut
quicunque non adorauerit imaginem bestiae, occcidatur. Et faciet omnes pusillos
et magnos, et diuites, et pauperes, and liberos, and seruos, habere characterem
in dextera manu sua, aut in frontibus suis, et ne quis posset emere aut
uendere, nisi qui habeat characterem, aut nomen bestiae, aut numerum nominis
eius. Hic sapientia est. Qui habet intellectum, computet numerum bestiae.
Numerus enim hominis est, et numerus eius sex centi sexaginta sex.

CAPVT XIIII.
ET uidi et agnus stabat supra montem Sion, et cum eo centum quadraginta
quatuor milia, habentes nomen eius, et nomen patris eius scriptum in frontibus
suis. Et audiui uocem de coelo tanquam uocem aquarum multarum, et tanquam uocem
tonitrui magni: et uocem quam audiui, sicut citharoedorum citharizantium in
citharis suis. Et cantabant quasi canticum nouum ante sedem, and ante quatuor
animalia, and seniores, and nemo poterat discere canticum, nisi illa centum
quadraginta quatuor milia, qui empti sunt de terra. Hi sunt qui cum mulieribus
non sunt coinquinati: uirgines enim sunt. Hi sequuntur agnu^ quocunque ierit.
Hi empti sunt ex hominibus primitiae Deo and agno, et in ore eorum non est
inuentum mendacium. Sine macula enim sunt ante thronum Dei. Et uidi alterum
angelum ^olantem per medium coeli, habentem euangelium aeternum, ut
euangelizaret sedentibus super terram, et super omnem gentem, et tribum, et
linguam, et populum, dicens magna uoce: Timete Dominum, et date illi honorem,
quia uenit hora iudicii eius, et adorate eum, qui fecit coelum, et terram,
mare, et fontes aquarum. Et alius angelus secutus est eum, dicens: Cecidit,
cecidit Babylon illa magna, quae a uino irae fornicationis suae, potauit omnes
gentes. Et tertius angelus secutus est illos, dicens uoce magna: Si quis
adorauerit bestiam et imaginem eius, et acceperit characterem in front sua,
aut in manu sua, et hic bibet de uino irae Dei, quod mixtum est mero in calice
irae ipsius: et cruciabitur igne and sulphur in conspectu angelorum sanctorum,
et ante conspectum agni: et fumus tormentorum eorum ascendit in secula
seculorum, nec habent requiem die acnocte, qui adorauerunt bestiam, et imaginem
eius: and si quis acceperit characterem nominis eius. Hic patientia sanctorum
est, qui custodiunt mandata Dei (...) fidem IESV. Et audiui uocem de coelo,
dicentem mihi: Scribe: Beati mortui qui in Domino moriuntur. Amodo iam dicit
spiritus, ut requiescant a laboribus suis: opera enim illorum sequuntur illos.
Et uidi, and ecce nubem candidam, et super nubem sedentem similem filio
hominis, habentem in capite suo coronam auream, et in manu sua falcem acutam.
Et alius angelus exiuit de templo, clamans uoce magna ad sedentem super nubem:
Mitte falcem tuam, et mete, quia uenit hora ut metatur, quoniam aruit messis
terrae, and misit qui sedebat super nubem falcem sua^ in terram, and demessuit
eam. Et alius angelus exiuit de templo, quod est in coelo, habens et ipse
falcem acutam. Et alius angelus exiuit de altari, qui habebat potestatem supra
ignem, et clamauit uoce magna ad eum qui habebat falsam acutam, dicens: Mitte
falsam tuam acutam, et uindemia botros uineae terrae, quoniam maturae sunt uuae
eius. Et misit angelus falcem suam acutam in terram, and uindemiauit uineam
terrae, and misit in lacum irae Dei magnum, and calcatus est lacus extra
ciuitatem, et exiuit sanguis de lacu, usque ad frenos equorum per stadia mill
sexcenta.

CAPVT XV.
ET uidi aliud signum in coelo magnum et mirabile, angelos septe^, habentes
plagas septem nouissimas, quoniam in illis consummata est ira Dei. Et uidi
tanquam mare uitreum mixtum igne, and eos qui uicerunt bestiam, et imaginem
eius, and numerum nominis eius stantes supe^ mare uitreum, habentes citharas
Dei, et cantantes canticum Mosi serui Dei, and canticum ag^i, dicentes: Magna
et mirabilia sunt opera tua Domine Deus omnipote^s, iustae and uerae sunt uiae
tuae rex seculorum. Quis no^ timebit te domine, and magnificabit nome^ tuu^?
quia solus pius e^, quonia^ oe^s gentes uenie^t, and adorabunt in conspectu
tuo, quonia^ iudicia tua manifesta sunt. Et post haec uidi, and ecce apertu^
est te^plu^ tabernaculi testimonii in coelo, et exieru^t septe^ angeli,
habentes septe^ plagas de te^plo, uestiti lino mu^do and ca^dido, and prae
ci^cti circa pectora zonis aureis. Et unu^ de quatuor ai^libus, dedit septem
angelis septe^ phialas aureas, plenas iracundiae Dei uiue^tis in secula
seculorum. Et impletum est templum dei fumo a maiestate Dei and uirtute eius,
and nemo poterat introire in templu^, donec consummarentur septem plagae septem
angelorum.

CAPVT XVI.
ET audiui uocem magnam de templo dicentem septem angelis: Ite, and effu^dite
septem phialas irae Dei in terra^. Et ab^it primus angelus, and effudit phialam
sua^ in terram, and factum est uulnus saeuu^ and pessimu^ in homines qui
habebant charactere^ bestiae, and in eos qui adorauerunt bestiam and imaginem
eius. Et secu^dus angelus effudit phiala^ suam in mare, and factus est sanguis
tanqua^ mortui, and omnis anima uiuens mortua est in mari. Et tertius angelus
effudit phialam sua^ super flumina, and super fontes aquaru^, and factus est
sanguis. Et audiui angelum aquarum dicente^: Iustus es dn^e, qui es, and qui
eras, sanctus, qui hoc iudicasti: quia sanguinem sanctoru^ et prophetarum
effuderunt, et sanguinem eis dedisti bibere: digni em^ sunt. Et audiui alterum
angelu^ dicentem: Etiam Domine Deus omnipotens, uera et iusta iudicia tua. Et
quartus angelus effudit phialam suam suam in solemn, et datum est illi aestu
affligere homines et igni. Et aestuauerunt homines aestu magno, and
blasphemauerunt nomen Dei, habentis potestatem super has plagas, ne que egerunt
poenitentiam, ut dare^t illi gloriam. Et quintus angelus effudit phialam suam
super sedem bestiae, and factum est regnum eius tenebrosum, and
co^manducauerunt linguas suas prae dolor, and blasphemauerunt Deum coeli prae
doloribus et uulneribus suis, and non egerunt poenitentiam ex operibus suis. Et
sextus angelus effudit phialam suam in flumen illud magnum Euphrate, and
siccauit aquam eius, ut praepararetur uia regibus ab ortu solis. Et uidi de ore
draconis, et de ore bestiae, and de ore pseudoprophetae exire spiritus tres
immundos, in modum ranarum. Sunt enim spiritus daemoniorum, facientes signa,
and procedunt ad reges totius terrae, congregare illos in praelium ad diem
magnum omnipotentis Dei. Ecce uenio cito sicut fur. Beatus qui uigilat, and
custodit uestimenta sua, ne nudus ambulet, and uideant turpitudinem eius. Et
congregabit illos in locu^, q uocatur hebraice Armageddo^. Et septimus a^gelus
effudit phiala^ sua^ in aere^, and exiuit uox magna de te^plo a throno, dice^s:
Factum est. Et facta sunt fulgura, and uoces, and tonitrua, and terraemotus
factus est magnus, qualis nu^quam fuit, ex quo hoi^es fueru^t super terra^,
talis terraemotus sic magnus. Et facta est ciuitas magna in tres parts, and
civitates gentium ceciderunt. Et Babylon magna uenit in memoria^ ante deum,
dare illi calice^ uini indignationis irae eius. Et omnis insula fugit and
mo^tes non sunt inuenti. Et grando magna sicut talentum descendit de coelo, in
homines, and blasphemauerunt Deu^ hoi^es propter plagam grandinis: quoniam
magna facta est uehementer.

CAPVT XVII.
ET uenit unus de septe^ angelis qui habebant septem phialas, and locutus est
mecum, dicens: Veni, and oste^dam tibi damnatione^ meretricis magnae, quae
sedet super aquas multas, cum qua fornicati sunt reges terrae, and inebriati
sunt qui inhabitaba^t terra^ de uino prostitutio^is eius. Et abstulit me in
spiritu in desertum. Et uidi muliere^ sedente^ super bestiam coccinea^ plenam
nominibus blasphemiae, habentem capita septe^ and cornua december. Et mulier erat
circundata purpura and coccino, and inaurata auro and lapide precioso, and
margaritis, habens poculum aureum in manu sua, plenum abominatione et
immundicia fornicationis suae. Et in front eius nomen scriptu^, mysterium:
Babylon magna matter fornicationum and obominationum terrae. Et uidi mulierem
ebriam de sanguine sanctorum, and de sanguine martyrum IESV. Et miratus sum cum
uiderem illam admiratione magna. Et dixit mihi angelus: Quare miraris? Ego
dicam tibi sacramentum mulieris, et bestiae quae portat eam, quae habet capita
septem and cornua december. Bestia quam uidisti, fuit, et non est, et ascensura
est de abysso, et in interitum ibit, et mirabuntur inhabitants terram, quorum
non sunt scripta nomina in libro uitae a constitutione mundi, uidentes* bestiam
quae erat, et non est. Et hic est sensus qui habet sapientiam. Septem capita,
septem montes sunt, super quos mulier sedet, et reges septem sunt. Quinque
ceciderunt, unus est, et alius nondum uenit, et cu^ uenerit, oportet illum
breue te^pus manner. Et bestia quae erat, et non est, ipsa octaua est, et de
septem est, et in interitum uadit. Et december cornua quae uidisti, december reges
sunt, qui regnum nondum acceperu^t, sed potestatem tanquam reges una hora
accipient post bestiam. Hi unu^ consiliu^ habent, et uirtutem, et potestatem
suam bestiae trad^nt. Hi cum agno pugnabunt, et agnus uincet illos: quoniam
Dominus dominorum est, and Rex regu^: and qui cum illo sunt, uocati, et electi,
and fideles. Et dixit mihi: Aquae quas uidisti ubi meretrix sedet, populi sunt,
and Gentes, et linguae. Et december cornua quae uidi^^i in bestia, hi odient
fornicariam, and desolatam facient illam, et nudam, et carnes eius manducabunt,
et ipsam igni concremabunt. Deus enim dedit in corda eorum, ut faciant quod
placitum est illi, ut dent regnum suum bestiae, donec consummentur uerba Dei.
Et mulier quam uidisti, est ciuitas magna, quae habet regnum super reges terrae.

CAPVT XVIII.
ET post haec uidi alium angelum descendentem de coelo, habentem potestatem
magnam, et terra illuminata est a gloria eius. Et exclamauit in fortitudine,
dicens: Cecidit, cecidit Babylon magna, and facta est habitatio daemoniorum,
and custodia oi^s spiritus immundi, and custodia omnis uolucris immundae and
odibilis: quia de uino irae fornicationis eius biberunt omnes Gentes, and reges
terrae cum illa fornicati sunt, and mercatores terrae de uirtute deliciarum
eius diuites facti sunt. Et audiui aliam uocem de coelo, dicentem: Exite de
illa popule meus, et ne participes sitis delictorum eius, and de plagis eius
non accipiatis. Quoniam peruenerunt peccata eius usque ad coelum, and
recordatus est Dominus iniquitatum eius. Reddite illi, sicut et ipsa reddidit
uobis, and duplicate duplicia secundum opera eius. In poculo quo miscuit uobis,
miscete illi duplum. Qua^tum glorificauit se, et in delitiis fuit, tantum date
illi tormentum et luctum. Quia in cord suo dicit: Sedeo regina, et uiduan on
sum, and luctum non uidebo: Ideo in una die uenient plagae eius, mors, et
luctus, and fames, and igne comburetur: quia fortis est Deus qui iudicabit
illam. Et flebunt et plangent se super illam reges terrae, qui cum illa
fornicati sunt, and in delitiis uixerunt, cum uiderint fumum incendii eius
long stantes, propter timore^ torme^toru^ eius, dicentes: Vae, uae ciuitas
illa magna Babylon, ciuitas illa fortis, quoniam una hora ueniet iudicium tuum.
Et negociatores terrae flebunt, et lugebunt super illam, quoniam merces eorum
nemo emet amplius, merces auri, and argenti, et lapidis preciosi, and
margaritae, et byssi, et purpurae, and serici, and cocci, et, omne lignu^
thynu^, and omnia uasa eboris, et omnia uasa de lapide precioso, et aeramento,
et ferro, et marmore, and cynomomum, and amomum, and odoramentorum, and
unguenti, et thuris, and uini, and olei, and similae, and tritici, and
iumentorum, and ouium, and equorum, et rhedarum, et ma^cipioru^, et animaru^
hoi^m. Et poma desyderii ai^ae tuae discesserunt a te, and oi^a pinguia, and
pra^ clara perieru^t a te, et a^plius illa ia^ non i^uenie^t mercatores horu^.
Qui diuites facti sunt ab ea, long stabunt, propter timorem tormentorum eius,
flentes, ac luge^tes, et dicentes: Vae, uae, ciuitas illa magna quae amicta
erat bysso, and purpura, and cocco, and deaurata erat auro, et lapide precioso,
et margaritis: quoniam una hora destitutae sunt tantae diuitiae. Et omnis
gubernator et omnes qui in lacu nauigant, et nautae, et qui in mari operantur,
long steteru^t, et clamaueru^t uidentes locum incendii eius, dicentes: Quae
similis ciuitati huic magnae? Et miserunt puluerem super capita sua, and
clamauerunt, flentes et lugentes, dicentes: Vae, uae, ciuitas illa magna, in
qua diuites facti sunt oe^s sunt, qui habebant naues in mari de preciis eius:
quoniam una hora desolata est. Exulta super eam coelum, and sancti Apostoli,
and prophetae: qm^ iudicauit Deus iudicium uestru^ de illa. Et sustulit unus
angelus fortis lapidem, quasi molarem magnum, and misit in mare, dicens: Hoc
impetu mittetur Babylon ciuitas illa magna, and ultra iam non inuenietur. Et
uox citha^oedoru^, and musicoru^, and tibia canentiu^: and tuba no^ audietur in
te amplius, and oi^s artifex oi^sque ars no^ inuenietur in te a^plius, and uox
molae non audietur in te amplius, and lux lucernae non lucebit in te amplius,
and uox spo^si and spo^sae no^ audietur adhuc i^ te: qa mercatores tui era^t
principes terrae, qa in ueneficiis tuis erraueru^t oe^s ge^tes Et in ea sanguis
propheta^um and sanctorum inuentus est, and omnium qui interfecti sunt in terra.

CAPVT XIX.
POst haec audiui qua^^ uocem turbarum multarum in coelo dicentium: Alleluia.
Laus, and gloria, and uirtus Deo nostro est, quia uera and iusta iudicia sunt
eius qui iudicauit de meretrice magna, quae corrupit terram in prostitutione
sua, and uindicauit sanguinem seruorum suorum de manibus eius. Et iterum
dixerunt: Alleluia. Et fumus eius ascendit in secula seculorum. Et cecideru^t
seniores uigintiquatuor, and quatuor animalia, and adorauerunt Deum sedentem
super thronum, dicentes: Amen, Alleluia. Et uox de throno exiuit, dicens:
Laudem dicite Deo nostro omnes sancti eius, and qui timetis eum pusilli and
magni. Et audiui quasi uocem turbae magnae, and sicut uocem aquarum multarum,
and sicut uocem tonitruorum magnorum, dicentium: Alleluia, quoniam regnauit
Dominus Deus noster omnipotens. Gaudeamus, and exultemus, and demus gloriam ei,
quia uenerunt nuptiae agni, et uxor eius praeparauit se. Et datum est illi ut
cooperiatse byssino splendenti and candido. Byssinu^ enim iustificationes sunt
sanctorum. Et dixit mihi: Scribe: Beati qui ad coena^ nuptiaru^ uocati sunt
agni. Et dixit mihi: Haec uerba Dei uera sunt. Et cecidi ante pedes eius, ut
adorarem eum. Et dixit mihi: Vide ne feceris: Conseruus enim tuus sum, et
fratrum tuorum habentium testimonium IESV. Deum adora. Testimonium enim IESV
est spiritus prophetiae. Et uidi coelum apertum, et ecce equus albus, et qui
sedebat super eum, uocabatur Fidelis et Verax, et cum iustitia iudicat and
pugnat. Oculi autem eius sicut flamma ignis, et in capite eius diade mata
multa, habens nome^ scriptum, quod nemo nouit, nisi ipse. Et uestitus e^ar
ueste aspersa sanguine, and uocabatur nomen eius Verbum Dei. Et exercitus qui
sunt in coelo, sequebantur eum in equis albis, uesti^i by^lo albo et mundo. Et
de ore eius procedit gladius, ex utraque part acutus, ut in ipso percutiat
Gentes, et ipse reget eas in uirga ferrea, et ipse calcat torcular uini furoris
irae Dei omnipotentis. Et habet in uestimento et in ^emore suo scriptum: Rex
regum, et Dominus dominantium. Et uidi unum angelum stantem in sole, et
clamauit uoce magna, dicens omnibus auibus quae uolabant per medium coeli:
Venite, et congregamini ad coenam magnam Dei, ut ma^ducetis carnes regu^, et
carnes tribunoru^, et carnes fortium, et carnes equorum, and sedentium in
ipsis, et carnes omnium liberorum et seruorum, et pusillorum, et magnorum. Et
uidi bestiam, et reges terrae, and exercitus eorum congregatos ad faciendum
praelium cum illo qui sedebat in equo, et cum exercitu eius. Et apprehensa est
bestia, and cum ea pseudopropheta, qui fecit signa coram ipso, quibus seduxit
eos, qui acceperunt characterem bestiae, and qui adorauerunt imaginem eius.
Viui missi sunt hi duo in stagnum ignis ardentis sulphur: et caeteri occisi
sunt in gladio sedentis super equum qui procedit de ore ipsius, et omnes aues
saturatae sunt carnibus eorum.

CAPVT XX.
ET uidi angelum desce^dentem de coelo, habentem clauem abyssi, et catenam
magna^ in manu sua. Et apprehendit draconem serpentem antiquum, qui est
diabolus et satanas, et ligauit eum per annos mill, et misit eum in abyssum,
et clausit, and signauit super illum, ut non seducat amplius gentes, donec
consummentur mill anni, post hoc oportet illum solui modico tempore. Et uidi
seeds, et sederunt super eas, et iudicium datum est illis: et animas
decollatorum propter testimonium IESV, et propter uerbum Dei, et qui non
adorauerunt bestiam, neque imaginem eius, nec acceperunt characterem eius in
frontibus aut in manibus suis, and uixeru^t and regnauerunt cum Christo mill
annis. Caeteri uero mortuorum non uixerunt, donec consumme^tur mill anni. H^ec
est resurrectio prima. Beatus and sanctus qui habet partem in resurrectione
prima. In his secunda mors non habet potestatem, sed erunt sacerdotes Dei and
Christi, and regnabunt cum illo mill annis. Et ^um consummati fuerint mill
anni, soluetur satanas de carcere suo, et exibit, and seducet gentes quae sunt
super quatuor angulos terrae Gog et Magog, et congregabit eos in praelium,
quorum numerus est sicut arena maris. Et ascenderunt super latitudinem terrae,
and circumierunt castra sanctorum, and ciuitatem dilectam. Et descendit ignis a
Deo de coelo, and deuorauit eos, and diabolus qui seducebat eos, missus est in
stagnum ignis and sulphuris, ubi and bestia and pseudoprophetae cruciabuntur
die ac nocte in secula seculorum. Et uidi thronum magnum and candidum, and
sedentem super eu^, a cuius conspectu fugit terra and coelum, and locus no^ est
inuentus eis. Et uidi mortuos magnos and pusillos, stantes in co^spectu throni,
and libri aperti sunt: and alius liber apertus est, qui est uitae, and iudicati
su^t mortui ex his, quae scripta era^t in libris secundu^ opera ipsoru^: and
dedit mare mortuos suos q in eo era^t, and mors and infernus dederu^t mortuos
suos q in ipsis erant, and iudicatum est de singulis secu^dum opera ipsorum. Et
infernus et mors missi sunt in stagnum ignis. Haec est mors secunda. Et qui non
inuentus est in libro uitae scriptus, missus est in stagnum ignis.

CAPVT XXI.
ET uidi coelum nouum, et terram nouam: primum enim coelum, et prima terra
abiit, et mare iam non est. Et ego Ioannes uidi sanctam ciuitatem Jerusalem
nouam, descendentem de coelo, a Deo paratam, sicut sponsam ornatam uiro suo. Et
audiui uocem magnam de throno dicentem: Ecce tabernaculum Dei cum hominibus, et
habitabit cum eis: et ipsi populus eius erunt, et ipse Deus cum eis erit eorum
Deus: et absterget Deus omnem lach^ymam ab oculis eorum, et mors ultra non
erit, neque luctus, neque clamor, neque dolor erit ultra: quia prima abierunt.
Et dixit qui sedebat in throno: Ecce noua facio omnia. Et dixit mihi: Scribe,
quia haec uerba fidelissima sunt and uera. Et dixit mihi: Factum est. Ego sum
alpha et o, initium et finis. Ego sitienti dabo de font aquae uiuae gratis.
Qui uicerit, possidebit haec: et ero illi Deus, et ille erit mihi filius.
Timidis autem et incredulis, et execratis, and homicidis, and fornicatoribus,
and ueneficis, and idololatris, and omnibus me^dacibus pars illoru^ erit in
stagno arde^ti igne et sulphur, quod est mors secunda. Et uenit unus de septe^
angelis, habe^tibus phialas plenas septem plagis nouissimis, and locutus est
mecu^, dice^s: Veni, and ostenda^ tibi sponsam, uxorem agni. Et sustulit me in
spiritu in montem magnum and altum, and ostendit mihi ciuitatem sanctam
Jerusalem, descendentem de coelo a Deo, habentem claritatem Dei, and lumen
eius simile lapidi precioso, tanquam lapidi Iaspidis, sicut Cristallum. Et
habebat muru^ magnum and altum, habente^ portas duodecim, and in portis angelos
duodecim, and nomina inscripta, quae sunt nomina duodecim tribuu^ filioru^
Israel. Ab orient portae tres, ab aquilone portae tres, ab austro portae tres,
ab occasu portae tres. Et murus ciuitatis habens fundamenta duodecim, and in
ipsis duodecim nomina duodecim Apostoloru^ agni. Et qui loquebatur mecum,
habebat mensuram arundinea^ aurea^, ut metiretur ciuitatem, and portas eius,
and muru^. Et ciuitas in quadro posita est, longitudo eius ta^ta est, qua^ta
and latitudo: and me^sus est ciuitate^ de arundine aurea per stadia duodeci^
milia, longitudo, and altitudo, and latitudo eius aequalia su^t. Et me^sus est
muru^ eius ce^tu^ quadragi^ta quatuor cubitotu^, me^sura hoi^s, q^ est angeli.
Et erat structura muri ex lapide Iaspide: ipsa uero ciuitas aurum mu^dum,
simile uitro mundo. Et fundame^ta muri ciuitatis omni lapide precioso ornata.
Fundamentum primum Iaspis, secundum Sapphyrus, tertium Calcedonius, quartum,
Smaragdus: quintum, Sardonix, sextum, Sardius, septimum, Chrysolytus, octauum,
Berillus, nonum, Topazius, decimum, Chrysoprasus, undecimu^, Hyacinthus,
duodecimum, Amethystus. Et duocim portae, duodecim margaritae sunt per
singulas, and singulae portae, era^t ex singulis margaritis: and platea
ciuitatis, aurum mundum, tanquam uitru^ perlucidum: and templum non uidi in ea.
Dominus em^ Deus omnipotens, templum illius est and agnus. Et ciuitas non eget
sole, neque luna, ut luceant in ea: nam claritas Dei illuminabit e^, and
lucerna eius est agnus. Et ambulabunt gentes in lumine eius, and reges terrae
affere^t gloria^ sua^, and honorem in illa^. Et portae eius non claudentur per
diem: nox enim no^ erit illic. Et afferent gloriam and honorem gentium in
illam. No^ intrabit in eam aliquid coinquinatu^, aut abominatione^ faciens and
mendacium, nisi qui scripti sunt in libro uitae agni.

CAPVT XXII.
ET ostendit mihi fluuiu^ aquae uiuae, sple^didum tanqua^ Cristallu^,
procedentem de sede Dei and agni. In medio plateae eius, and ex utraque part
flumini^ lignum uitae, afferens fructus duodecim, per menses singulos fructum
suum, and folia ligni ad sanitatem gentium. Et omne maledictum non erit
amplius, sed seeds Dei and agni in illa erunt, and serui eius seruient illi, et
uidebunt faciem eius, et nomen eius in frontibus eorum. Et nox ultra non erit,
et non egebunt lumine lucernae, neque lumine solis: quo niam Dominus Deus
illuminabit illos, et regnabunt in secula seculorum. Et dixit mihi: Haec uerba
fidelissima sunt and uera. Et Dominus Deus spirituum prophetarum misit angelum
suum ostendere seruis suis, quae oportet fieri cito. Et ecce uenio uelo citet.
Beatus qui custodit uerba prophetiae libri huius: et ego Ioannes qui audiui,
and uidi haec: Et postquam audissem and uidissem, cecidi ut adorarem ante pedes
angeli, qui mihi haec ostendebat, et dixit mihi: Vide ne feceris: conseruus
enim tuus sum, et fratrum tuorum prophetarum, et eorum qui servant uerba
prophetiae libri huius. Deum adora. Et dixit mihi: Ne signaueris uerba
prophetiae libri huius: tempus enim prope est. Qui nocet, noceat adhuc: et qui
in sordibus est, sordescat adhuc: et qui iustus est, iustificetur adhuc: and
sanctus, sanctificetur adhuc. Ecce uenio cito, and merces mea mecum est reddere
unicuique secundum opera sua. Ego sum alpha et o, primus and nouissimus,
principium et finis. Beati qui lauant stolas suas in sanguine agni, ut sit
potestas eorum in ligno uitae, et per portas intrent in ciuitatem. Foris canes
et uenefici, and impudici, and homicidae, and idolis seruientes, and omnis qui
amat and facit mendacium. Ego JESUS misi angelum meum, testificari uobis haec
in ecclesiis: Ego sum radix and genus David* stella splendida and matutina. Et
spiritus and sponsus dicunt: Veni. Et qui audit, dicat: Veni. Et qui sitit,
ueniat: and qui uult, accipiat aquam uitae gratis. Contestor enim omni audienti
uer^a prophetiae libri huius. Si quis apposuerit ad haec, apponet Deus super
illum plagas scriptas in libro isto. Et si quis diminuerit de uerbis libri
prophetiae huius, auferet Deus partem eius de libro uitae, et de ciuitate
sancta, et de his quae scripta sunt in libro isto. Dicit qui testimonium
perhibet istorum. Etiam uenio cito: Ame^. Veni Domine IESV. Gratia Domini
nostri IESV, Christi cum omnibus uobis. Amen.

Finis apocalypsis Ioannis Apostoli.
Finis noui testamenti.

ye holy ghost. But seeing Joseph her husband was ryghteous and would not bring
her to shame, he was minded to put her away preuely. But while he thus
thought, behold, the angel of ye LORD appeared unto him in slepes, saying:

thou son of David, fear not you to take Mary thy wife: for ye which is borne
in her, is of the holy ghost. She shall truly bring forth a son, ^ctu. 4. ^

shall be called Emanuel, which is interpreted: God with us. Joseph truly arysynge
from sleep, did as the angel of the LORD commanded him, and took his wise,
and knew her not, till she Luc. 2. ^
brought forth her fyrstborne son, and called his name Jesus.

The.ii. Chapter.
When Jesus therefore was Mich. 5. a.
And thou Bethleem in the land of Iewry art not the least among the princes
of Iewry: Ioh. 7. d.
For out of ye shall there come forth a captayn, which shall govern Psalm. 71. b.
Esa. 60. a.
falling down flat, worshipped him. And when they had opened their treasures,
they offered unto him gifts: gold, frankynce^ce, and myrre. And the answer
being received in slepes that they should not go again unto Herod, they
returned in to their own contry by another Exodi. 4. d.
fly in to Egipte, and be there till I bring ye word. For it will come to
pass, that Herod shall seek the child to destroy him. Which rysynge up,
took the child and his mother by night, and departed in to Egipte, and was
there until the death of Herod, That it might be fulfilled which was spoken
of the LORD by ye prophet saying: Number. 24. c Oz^e. 11. a
Out of Egypt have I called my son. Then Herod seeing that he was mocked of
ye wise men, was exceadynge wroth, and (sendyng forth) flewe all the children yt
were in Bethleem and in all the coasts thereof, from the age of two year and
under, according to ye time yt he had sought out of ye wise men. Tha^ was it
fulfilled that was spoken by Jeremy the prophet, saying: Iere. 31. c.
In Rama was there a voice herd, weeping and great howlynge, Rachel bewailing
her chylderen, and would not be comforted, because they are not. and go in to
the land of Israel: For they are dead that sought the life of the child.
Which rysyng up, took the child and his mother, and came in to the land of
Israel. But he hearing ye Archelaus raygned in Iewry in stead of Herod his
father (and being admonished in slepes) departed in to the coasts of Galile.
And he coming dwelt in a city which is called Nazareth, ye it might be
fulfilled, which was spoken by ye prophets: How that Jude. 13. b
he shall be called a Nazarite.

The.iii. Chapter.
IN those days Marci. 1. a. Luce. 3 a Ioh. 3. d.

Do ye penance, for the kingdom of heavens is drawn nigh. For Ioh. 1. b.

The voice of a crier in the wilderness. Prepare ye the way of ye LORD, make
his paths straight 4. Reg. 1. b.
But Ihon himself had a garment of Camels here, and a lethre^ gyrdell about
his loins. His meat was locustes and wild honey. Than went forth unto him
Jerusalem, and al Iewry and all the contry about Iordane, and were baptized of
him in Iordane co^fessyng their sins. Luce. 3. b
But he seeing many of ye Pharisees and Saduces coming to his baptyme, said unto
the^: Ye generacio^ of vipers, who certified you to fly from ye wrath to come?
Do therefore worthy fruit of penance And think not ye to say wtin your selves:
We have a father, Abraham. For I say unto you, that God is able out of these
stones to raise up children unto Abraham, for even now is the are put to ye
root of ye trees. Math. 7. b. Luce. 3. c
Every tree therefore that yeldeth not good fruit, shall be hewe^ down, Marci. 1.

I verily do baptize you in water unto penance: but he that shall come after
me, is stronger than I, whose shues I am not able to bear: He shall baptyse
you in ye holy ghost and fire: Luce. 3. c
Whose fan is in his hand, and he shall cleanse his floor, and gather ye
wheat in to his barn: but the chafe shall he burn with vnque^cheable fire.
Marci. 1. a.

I ought to be baptized of the, and co^mest thou unto me? Jesus answering said

The.iiii. Chapter.
Marci. 1. b. Luce. 4. a.
was Jesus led of the sprete in to wilderness, that he might be tempted of the
deuell. And wha^ he had fasted forty days and forty nyghtes, he was
afterward an hungered. And the tempter approchynge nigh, said unto him: If thou
be the son of God, say the word yt these stones may be made bread. Which
answeryng said: It is written: Deute. 8. a. Sapi. 16. c.
Man lives not in bread only, but in every word that proceeds out of the
mouth of God. Tha^ the deuell took him up in to the holy city, and set him
upon the pynacle of the temple and says unto him: If thou be ye son of God,
cast thyselfe downewarde. For it is written: Psalm. 90. ^.
How that he has given his angels charge concerning the, and they shall take
the in their hands, lest thou hurt thy foot against a stone. Jesus said unto
him again: It is written: Deute. 6. c
Thou shall not te^pte the LORD thy God. Again, ye deuel Deute. 6. c. 1. Reg.
7. a.

the angels came and ministered unto him. Marci. 1. b. Luce. 4. d.

The land of Zabulo^ and the land of Nepthalim, ye way of the sea beyond

light: and to them that sat in the region of the shadow of death, even unto
them is ye light risen up. Marci. 1. b.
From that time forth began Jesus to preach and to say: Math 3. a.
Do ye penance, for the kingdom Marci. 1. b. Luce. 5. a
Jesus walking by the sea of Galile, saw two brethren: Simon, which is
called Peter, and Andrewe his brother casting a net in to the sea (for they
were fyshers) and he said unto them: Come ye after me, and I will make you to
become Iere. 16. c Ezec. 47. b
fyshers of men. And immediately (the nets being left) followed him. And he
going forth thence* saw other two brethren, James of Zebede and Iho^ his
brother in a ship with Zebede their father, mendynge their nets. And he called
them. Math. 19. d Luce. 5. b
They immediately (ye nets and father being left) followed him. Marci. 1. ^.
And Jesus went about all Galile, teaching in their synagoges and preaching
the Gospel of the kingdom, and healynge every disease and every infirmite in
the people. And the fame of him went out in to all Siria. And they presented
unto him all such as were vexed with sun^rye diseases, and taken with maladies,
and them that had deuels and such as were lunatyke, and me^ diseased of the
palsye, and he healed the^. Marci. 3. a. Luce. 6. b.
And the^ followed him great multytudes out of Galile, and from the ten
cities, and from Jerusalem, and out of Iewry, and from beyond Iordane.

The.v. Chapter.
Jesus seeing the people, Luce. 6. c
Blessed are the poor in sprete, for theyrs is the kingdom of heavens.
Blessed are the meke, for they shall possess the earth. Esai. 61. a and. 60. b
Blessed are they that mourn, for they shall be comforted. Iere. 31 d
Blessed are they that honger and thyrst after righteousness, for they shall be
satisfied. Blessed are the merciful, for they shall obtain mercy. Blessed are
they that be of clean heart, for they shall se God. Blessed are ye
peacemakers, for they shall be called the children of God. Blessed are they that
suffer persecucion for righteousness sake, for theyrs is ye kingdom of
heavens. 1. Petri. 1. c 2. c. and. 4. c
Blessed are ye, when men shall speak evil of you, and persecute you, and
say al evil against you lyenge, for my sake: Actu. 5. c.
Rejoice ye and be glad, for plenteous is your reward in the heavens. For so
persecuted they the prophets, that were before you. Marci. 9. e Luce. 14. d
Ye are Marc. 4. b Luce. 8. b and. 11. c
Nether do they light a ca^dle, and put it under a bus^hell, but upon a
candelsticke, that it may give light unto all yt be in ye house. Math. 6. a 1.
Petri. 2. b
Let your light shine before me^, ye they may se your good works, and
glorifye your father which is in the heavens. Do not ye think, that I am
come to undo the law or the prophets. I am not come to undo, Mat. 1. c and.
2. c. d
but to fulfill. Verily I say unto you of a truth: Luce. 16. c. Esaias. 40. a
Till heaven and earth pass, there shall not one jot or one title escape from
the law, till all things be done. Iaco. 2. b Ezech. 18. b

Gather not treasures unto you in earth, where ye rust and moth does corruppe,

The light of thy body is thine eye. If thine eye be syngle, all thy whole body

No man may serve two masters: For either he shall hate ye one and love the

Which of you taking thought, may add one cubyte unto his stature? And why

Salomo^ in all his glory was clothed like as one of these. For if God so clothe
the grass of ye field, which is to day, and tomorowe is cast into the
furnace, how much more you o ye of little faith? Be not ye therefore careful,
saying: What shall we eat, or what shall we drink, or wherewythall shall we be
clothed: For all these things do the Heythen seek. For your father knows,
that ye have need of all these things. 3. Reg. 3. b

day is his travail.

he is diuyded against himself. How shall therefore his kingdom endure? And if

kingdom of God then is come into you. Luce. 11. c
Or how may any man enter into a strange man's house, and spoil his vessel,

that day Jesus going forth out of the house, sat by the sea side. And there

many prophets and ryghteous men have longed to se ye things which ye se, and

Hear ye therefore ye parable of the sower: Every one that hears the word of
the kingdom and understands not, the evil comes and takes away that
which was sown in his heart: This is he that is sown by the way side. He
that is sown upon the stony places, the same is he that hears the word, and
immediately receaueth it with joy. He has not a root in himself, but is but
for a time. When trouble and persecucion comes to pass for the words sake,
immediatlye he is offended. He that is sown in the thorns, the same is he
that hears the word of God, and the carfulness of this world and the
deceatfulnesse of riches choketh up the word, and it is made without fruit.
But he that is sown in the good ground, the same is he that hears and
understands the word, and brings fruit, and some yeldeth truly Marci. 4. c
Another parable put he forth unto them, saying: The kingdom of heavens is
become like unto a man that did sow good sede in his field. But while men were
on sleep, his enemy came, and sowed tares thereupon, even in the mids of the
wheat, and went his way. When the blade was grown up, and had yielded fruit,
tha^ appeared the tares also. But the servants of the householder coming
nigh, said unto him: Sir, did dest thou not sow good sede in thy field? Whence
therefore has it tares? And he said unto them: That same has the enuyous man
done. But the servants said unto him: Wylt thou we go and gather them up? And
he said: No, lest happily ye gatherynge the tares, pluck up the wheat also
together with them. Suffer ye either of them to grow unto the harvest, and in
the time of harvest I shall say to the reapers: Gather ye first the tares,
and bind them together in sheaues to burn, but gather the wheat in to my
barn. Another parable put he forth unto them saying. Math. 4. c. Luce. 13. b.
The kingdom of heavens is like unto a grane of mustarde sede, which a man
taking, sowed in his field which verily is the leest in all seeds. But when it

birds of ye air may come and dwell in the branches thereof. Another Luce.
1^. b

if that evil servant shall say in his heart: My lord makes long to come,
and shall begin to smite his fellows to eat and drink with the dronken:

hour that he knows not, and shall dyuide him and set his part with

Luce. 19. c
Like wise as a king taking his yourney into a strange contry called his
servants, and delivered his goods unto the^. And unto one he gave five
talentes, to another two, to another one: unto every one after his own power,
and went away strayghte way. But he that had received five talentes, went
and wrought in the same, and wanne other five. Likewise he that received two,
wanne other two also. But he that received the one, going dyggeth in the
earth, and hydeth his lords monye. After a long season came the lord of
those servants, and rekened with them. And he that had received five
tale^tes, coming near, brought other five talentes, saying: Sir, thou
delyueredest unto me five tale^tes: Behold, I have won above the^ other five
tale^tes. His lord said unto him: Mat. 24. d
Well thou good and faithful servant, because thou have been faithful over
little. I will set yt over much: enter in to the joy of thy lord. Coming nigh
also that had received two talentes, said: Lord thou delyueredest unto me two
tale^tes: Behold, I have won two other. His lord said unto him: Well thou
good and faithful servant, because thou have been faithful over little, I will
set over much: enter in to the joy of thy lord. strowed, and fearing I went
and hyd thy talente in the earth: lo, there thou have that thine is. But his
lord answering said unto him* Thou evil and slowthfull servant, knew
thou that I reap where I sow not, and gather where I strowed not? Thou
ought therefore to have delivered my money to the exchaungers, and coming I
should verily have received that mine is with vauntage. Therefore take the
tale^t from him, and give it unto him yt has ten tale^tes. Math. 13. b Marc.

and say unto the people: He is risen from the dead: And the last error shall be
worse than the first. Pilate said unto the^: Ye have the watch, go, keep as ye
can. And they going away made the grave sure, sealynge the stone with watch
men.

which dawneth as dead. Marc. 16. a Luce. 24. a

there shall they se me. The which when they were gone, behold, some of the

by night, and we slepyng they have stolen him. And if that be herd of the
debite, we shall persuade him, and make you safe. And they the money taken, did
as they were taught. And ye word is noised by the Jews until this day. The
eleven disciples went in to Galile into the mountain where Jesus had
appointed them. And they seeing him worshipped: but some douted. And Jesus
coming near spoke unto them, saying: Math. 11. ^ Ioha^. 17. a Philip. 2. a

The end of the gospel after. Mathewe.
The holy Gospel of IESV CHRIST after Mark.
The First Chapter.
THe beginning of ye Mala. 3. b Math. 11. b Luce. 7. c
Behold, I send mine angel before thy face, which shall prepare thy way
before the. Esa. 40. a Math. 3. a Luce. 3. a Ioh. 1. b
The voice of a crier in the wilderness: Make ready the way of the LORD,
make his paths straight. Ioh. 3. d
Iho^ was in the wilderness, baptysynge and preaching the baptyme of penance
for the remission of sins. And all the land of Iewry went forth unto him,
and all they of Jerusalem, and were baptized of him in ye floude of Iordane,
confessing their sins. And Mat. 3. ^
Iho^ was clothed with the heeres of a Camel, and a lethre^ gyrdle about his
loins, and did eat wyld honey, and locustes, and preached, saying: Math. 3. b
Luce. 3. c Ioha^. 1. c
There comes one stronger than I after me, whose lachet of his shues I
stoupynge ame not worthy to lowse. I have baptized you in water, but he shall
baptyse you in ye holy ghost. Math. 3. b Luce. 3. c Ioha^. 1. d
And it happened in those days, Jesus came to Nazareth of Galile, and was
baptized of Iho^ in Jordan. And anon he coming up out of the water he saw
the heavens opened, and the holy ghost like a dove descendynge and abiding
upon him. And there was a voice made from the heavens: Thou Math. 4. a Luce. 4. a
And immediately the sprete drove him out in to ye desert. And he was in the
deserte forty days, and forty nyghtes, and was tempted of Satan: and he was in
the deserte with beasts, and the angels did service unto him. Math. 4. b Luc. 4.
b
But after that Iho^ was Mat. 6 b
taken, Jesus came in Galile, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God and
saying: Because the time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is come near,
repent and believe ye gospel. Math. 4. c Luce. 5. a
And going by the sea of Galile, he saw Simon and Andrew his brother,
casting nets in ye see (For they were fyshers) and Jesus said unto them:
Follow me, and I will make you to become Iere. 16. c Ezec. 47. b
fyshers of men. And forthwyth their nets left, they followed him. And being
gone a little from thence he saw James the son of Zebede and Ihon his

the Moon shall not give her light, and the stars of heaven shall be falling
down, and the powers that be in heaven shall be moved. Dani. 7. b
And than shall they se the son of man coming in the clouds with great
power and glory. And than shall he send forth his angels, and he shall gather
his chosen from the four wyndes, from the highest of the earth, unto the
highest of heaven. Math. 24. c Luce. 21. d
Learn a similitude of ye fyggetre: When his branch is now tender, and the
leaves be spronge, ye shall know that summer is at hand: Even so ye, wha^ ye
se these be done, be sure that it is nigh, [euen] in the doors: Verily I say
unto you, that this generation shall not pass, till all these things do
befall. Heaven and earth shall pass, but my words shall not pass. Actu. 1. a
But of that day or hour, knows noman, another ye angels in heaven, nor the
son, save the father. Math. 24. d and.25. a Luce. 12. d and.19. a
Take heed, watch and pray, for ye know not when it be time. Like as a man
that went in to a strange contrye, he left his house, and gave unto his
servants authorite of every work: and unto the porter he commanded to
watch. Watch ye therefore (for ye know not when the lord of the house will
come, at even, or or at mydnyghte, or at the cockcrowynge, or in the morning)
left when he shall come, he find you slepynge. But what I say unto you, I say
it unto all: Watch.

after a little while, they that stood by said unto Peter: Truly thou art one
of them for thou art a Galilean. But he began to curse and to swear: I know
not the man that ye speak of. And forthwith did the cock crow again. And
Peter remembered the word that Jesus said unto him: Before the cock have
crowed twyse, thou shall deny me thryse. And he began to weep.

The end of the gospel after Mark.
The holy Gospel of IESV CHRIST after Luke.
The Prologe.
FOrasmuch as many have endeavored to set in order the words of ye acts, that
are come to pass among us, like as they delivered them unto us, that first
saw the^ theyrselues, and were ministres of ye word: I thought it good also
(after that I had gotten the knowelege of all from the beginning) to write
them diligently unto the in order (good Theophile,) that thou may know the
truth of those words, whereof thou art enfourmed.

The First Chapter.

course of Abia, and his wife of the daughters of Aaron, and her name
Elizabeth. They were both ryghteous before God, and walking without blame in
all the commandments and iustifications of the LORD. And they had no
child, because that Elizabeth was baren, and they both well gone forth in
their days. And it came to pass, when Zachary executed the presthode before
God, in ye order of his course, (after ye costume of the presthode,) Exodus 30.

The.viii. Chapter.
Luc. 23. ^
and some women, which were healed of wicked spretes and diseases: Luce. 24. a

the air did eat it. And some fell upon a stone, and it being grown up,
wythered: for it had no moystnesse. And some fell among thorns, and the
thorns being grown up with it, choked it. And some fell upon good ground,
and it being grown up, gave fruit an hundredth fold. He saying this, Math.
13. b Marci. 4. a
And his disciples axed him, what similitude this were To whom he said: Unto
you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God, but unto ye other
in parables, that Esaie. 6. b
they seeing se not and hearing do not understand. But this is ye parable:
The sede is ye word of god. But they yt [are] by ye way side are they yt hear,
afterward comes the deuel, and takes away ye word out of their heart, lest
they beleuynge be saved. But they upon ye stone [are they,] which when they
have herd, they receive the word with joy, and they have no roots, because
they believe for a time, and in time of temtacion, they go back. But it that
fell among thorns, are they that have herd, and they going are choked of the
cares, and riches, and pleasures of this life, and bring no fruit. But it that
fell in the good ground, are they that in a good and best heart hearing the
word keep it, and bring forth fruit in patience. Math. 5. b Marci. 4. b Luce.

that knew it not, and did [thynges] worthy of strypes, he shall be beaten with
few. For unto every one who^ much is given, much shall be required of him: and
unto whom they have committed much, they shall require more of him. I am come
to Math. 2^. ^
baptized with a baptyme, and how am I payned, until it be fulended? Math. 1^.

Acertayne man had a fygge tree planted in his vyneyarde and he came seeking

Lo it is three year ago sense I come sekyng fruit on this fygge tree, and I

and let us eat and let us be merye: for this my son was dead, and is
revived: he was lost and is found. And they began to be and is revived: he
was lost, and is found.

The.xvi. Chapter.
ANd he said unto his disciples: faithful in the leest, is also faithful in the

will trust you it that is true? And if ye have not ben faithful in another
ma^s business, who will give you it that yours is? Math. 6. c
No servant can serve two masters: for either he shall hate the one, and love

serve God and Mammon. All these things herd the pharisees, which were

The end of the gospel after Luke.
The holy Gospel of IESV CHRIST after Ihon.
The first Chapter.
IN the beginning Gene. 1. a Pro. 8. c

The.ii. Chapter.
ANd upon the third day Luce. 2. ^
Woman, what have I to do with the? mine hour is not yet come. His mother said

that every pot contained a fyrke^ or a fyrken and a half
measures. Jesus said unto them: Fill the waterpottes with water. And they
filled the^ to the brymme. And Jesus said unto them: Draw now, and bring it
to the master of the feast. And they did bear it. But when the master of
the feast had taysted the water that was made wine, and knew not whence it
was, (but the mynisters that had drawn the water knew it,) the master of
the feast calls the brydegrome, and says unto him: Every man at the first
sets the good wine, and when they are drunk, than it that is worse: But
thou have kept the good wine hitherto. This beginning of miracles has Jesus

The *vi. Chapter*

went Jesus over the sea of Galile nigh to ye city Tyberias, and a great

Easter the Jews feast was at hand. When Jesus than had lyfted up his eyes,

but now is not my kingdom from hence. Than said Pilate unto him: Art thou a
king than? Jesus answered: Thou say it: for I am a king. I am born therefore

truth. Every one that is of the truth, hears my voice. Pilate says unto

a Luce. 23. a

The.xix. Chapter.
mat. 27. c. d Marci. 15. b Luce. 23. b
took Pilate Jesus and scourged him. And ye souldyers platyng a crown of

garden a new grave, wherein no man had yet ben laid: there laid they Jesus
because of the Jews day of preparynge, for the sepulcher was at hand.

The.v. Chapter.

know what these things will be. But all the Athenians and strangers gave

the God that made ye world, and all things that are therein. The same seeing

The.xviii. Chapter.
Roma. 16. a 2. Tim. 4. c
Aqu^la, borne in Po^tus, which lately was come from Italy, and Priscilla his

came to them. And because he was of the same craft, he did abide with them, and
wrought: (but they were tente makers,) and he disputed every sabbat day in the
synagoge, setting forth in ye mean while the name of the LORD Jesus, and
exhorted the Jews and Greeks. Actu. 17. c

The.xix. Chapter.

And there happened no small trouble at ye time of the way of the LORD. For one

Gaius and Aristarchus the Macedonians Paul's fellows being taken. But Paul

congregation was out of order, and many knew not for what cause they were come
together. Some of the people drue forth Alexander, the Jews thrustynge him
forward. But Alexander Actu. 21. d
silence being required with the hand, would have given the people an answer.

thing, it may be dispatched in a lawful congregation. For we also stand in
ieoparde to be accused of this days vproure, seeing there is noman gylty, of
whom we may give a count of this vproure. And when he had said these
things he let the congregation go.

that he spoke unto them in the Hebrew tunge, they kept the more silence. And

The.xxv. Chapter.
When Festus therefore was ten days, he went down to Cesarea. And the next
day did he sit upon the judgment seat, and commanded Paul to be brought
to him. Who wha^ he was brought, the Jews that were of Jerusalem stood about
him, layeng against him many and grievous causes, the which Actu. 24. b and.
28. c
I have sinned naught another against the law of ye Jews, nor the temple, nor
the Emperor. But festus willing to do the Jews a pleasure, answeryng unto
Paul he said: Wylt thou go up to Jerusalem, and there be judged of these
things before me? But Paul said: I do stand before the Emperors judgment
seat, there must I be judged. I have not hurt ye Jews as you know best For
if I have done hurt or ought worthy of death, I refuse not to dye: But if there
be none of those, whereof they accuse me, no man can give me unto them. I
appeal unto the Emperor. Than Festus having spoken with ye counsel,
answered: Thou have appealed unto the Emperor, unto the Emperor shalt thou
go. And when certain days were paste, king Agrippa and Bernice came down to
Cesarea to welcome Festus. And when* they did abide there many days, Festus
did Actu. 24. c
There is a man left bound of Felix, Actu. 24. a
for whom the high prestes and elders of the Jews came unto me, desiring a
sentence against him. Unto whom I made answer: Deuteronomy. 17. a
That the Romans use not to co^de^ne a man, before yt he that is accused have
his accusers present, and receive place of defe^dyng to clear [hymselfe] of
the fautes laid against him. When they therefore were come here together,
without any delay sitting upon the judgment seat the next day, I
commanded the man to be brought forth. Actu. ^^. ^
Of whom when the accusers stood, they brought no cause, where of I did
mysdeme any evil, but they had certain questions of their supersticion
against him, and of one Jesus dead, whom Paul did affirm to live. But I
doutynge of the same question, said whether be would go to Jerusalem, and there
be judged of these things? But Paul appealyng that he might be kept unto ye
Emperors knowledge, I have commanded him to be kept until I send him unto
the Emperor. But Agrippa said Actu. 23. b and. 26. c
to have done nothing worthy of death. And the same appealynge to the
Emperor have I judged to send to him, of whom I have no certaynte that I
may write unto my lord. Wherefore I brought him unto you and chefly unto the
king Agrippa, that examinacion had, I may have that I write. For it seems
unto me to be without reason to send a presoner and not to show his causes.

This man has done no thing worthy of death or bands. And Agrippa said unto
