with mine own hand. If any does not love our LORD Jesus Christ, the same
be That is: Cursed be he unto death.
Anathe mamaranatha. The grace of our LORD Jesus Christ be with you. My love
be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.

The end of the first Epistle of Paul ye Apostle to the Corinthians.
The second Epistle of the Apostle Paul to the Corinthians.
The first Chapter.
are in all Achia, Gala. 1. a Ephe. 1. a
Grace be with you and peace from God our father and the LORD Jesus Christ.
1. Petri. 1. a
Blessed be God, and the father of our LORD Jesus Christ, the father of
mercyes, and the God of all consolacion, which comfort us in all our
trouble, that we be able also to comfort the^ that are in every anguyshe, by
the exhortacion, where with we are also exhorted of God. Col. 1. c
For as the sufferynges of Christ are plenteous in us, even so also is our
consolacion plenteous through Christ. But whether we are troubled, [it is] for
your exhortacion and salvation, whether we are comforted, [it is] for your
consolacion, whether we are exhorted, [it is] for your admonicion and health,
the which does work the sufferau^ce of ye same grefes, the which we also do
suffer, that our hope is sure for you, knowing that as ye be partakers of the
sufferynges, so shall ye also be of the comfort. For we will not have you
Actu. 19. c
which happened in Asia, that out of measure we were grieved above our power,
insomuche that it lothed us also to live. But we had an answer of death in
ourselves yt we be not trusting in ourselves, 1. Regu^. 2. b
but in God, which rayseth the dead, which has delivered and ryd us of so
many parels, in whom we trust that he shall yet also deliver us, Phil. 2. a
if you do help also in [youre] prayer for us, 2. Cori. 4. c
that by many persons thanks may be given him for us, for the gift that is
in us. For our praise is this, [namely] ye witness of our conscience: that we
have had our conversation in this world in synglenesse of heart, and
syncerenesse of God, and not in carnal wisdom, but in the grace of God, most
plentyfully to you ward. For we write none other things unto you save them
that ye have red and known. But I trust that ye shall know [vs] until the
end, as ye have known Phili. 2. b 1. Tessa. 2. c
as ye are ours also. 1. cor. 16. a
And in this confidence would I first have come unto you, that ye might have
the second grace, and by you to go into Macedonia, and to come again to you
from Macedonia, and be brought of you in Iewry. When I therefore was thus
minded, did I use any lyghtnesse? Or the things yt I do mind, do I mind them
after the flesh? Math. 5. d Iaco. 5. c
that with me be ye and nay. But God is faithful, that our word which was
with you is not ye and nay in him, but is ye in him. For Jesus Christ the
son of God, which has been preached among you by us, [namely] by me, and
Syluanus, and Timotheus, was not ye and nay in him, but in him it was ye. For
as many promyses of God as are, in him they are ye. And therefore say we Amen
unto God by him, unto our praise. Roma. 8. b
But he that stablysheth us with you in Christ, [it is] God, which has also
anointed us, and which has Ephe. 4. c
sealed us, and has given the earnest of the sprete in our hearts. As for me,
Roma. 9. a.
I take God to record against my soul that fauourynge you I came no more to
Corinthus: not because we are 1. Pet. 5. a
lords over your faith, but are helpers of your joy. For ye stand in faith.

The.ii. Chapter.
But I have determined 1. Cor. 5. ^
The rebuke that is done by many, suffiseth him that is such one, so that
contrarywyse ye do rather forgive and be comforted: left he that is such one be
swalowed up with over great heaviness. Wherefore, I pray you yt ye stablyshe
love in him. For therefore have I written unto you, that I may know ye proof of
you, whether ye be obedient in all things. For whom ye have forgeuen ought,
to him do I forgive also. For I also that I have forgeuen, if I have forgeuen
ought, for your sakes [haue I forgeuen it] in ye person of God, that we be
not begyled of Satan: for we know his Actu. 16. b
Troada, because of the Gospel of Christ, and a door was opened unto me in the
LORD, I had no rest in my spret, because I did not find Titus my brother, but
byddinge the^ farewell, I went forth into Macedonia. But God be thanked, which
always gives us the victory in Christ Jesus, and Collos. 1. c
makes manifest the odoure of his knowledge in every place through us: for we
are ye good sauoure of Christ, unto them that are saved, and unto the^ that
perysh: Luce. 2. c
Unto some truly the sauoure of death unto death, unto some the sauoure of life
unto life. And who is so mete unto these things? For we are not (as many)
counterfaytynge the word of God, but we speak it of syncerenesse, as of God,
before God in Christ.

The.iii. Chapter.

we again to praise ourselves? Or need we (as some) of letters of co^mendacion

The.iiii. Chapter.
Esaias. 6. b Ioh. 1^ e
has blinded the minds of ye unfaithful, that the lightening of the Gospel
of ye glory of Christ, Col. 2 b
which is ye image of God, do not shine unto them. For we preach not ourselves,

that did command light to shine out of darkness, the same 2. Petri. 1. d
has shyned in our hearts, to the shynynge of the clearness of the knowledge
of God, in ye face of Christ Jesus. But we have this treasure in 2. Cori. 5. a
earthen vessels, that the excellency be of the power of God, and not of us. We
suffer trouble in all [places] but we are not put to distress: we are
enpoueryshed, but we are not destituted: we suffer persecucio^, but we are not
forsaken: we are brought low, but we are not brought to confusion: we are
thrust down, but we perysh not: Gala. 6. b
bearing always about the dyenge of Jesus Christ in our body, that ye life of
Jesus be also made manifest in our bodies. Roma. 8. c
For we that live, are always delivered into death because of Jesus, yt the life
also of Jesus may be showed in our mortal flesh. Death therefore works in us,
but life in you. But having ye same sprete of faith, as it is written: Psalm.
11^. ^
I have believed, wherefore I have spoken: we also believe, wherefore we speak
also, knowing yt he that has raised Jesus, shall raise us also with Jesus, and
shall set us with you. For all things are done for your sakes, yt the 2. Cor. 1. b
abundau^t grace, may be plenteous in geuyng of thanks by many, unto the glory
of God. For ye which cause we do not faynte, but though our outward man do
corru^pe, ye the yt is inward is renewed from day to day. Psalm. 29. a Romans 8.
c
For our trouble yt now is, which is te^porall and light, works in us a
weight of glory in ye heyght, out of measure, unto us not beholdynge ye
things yt are seen, but yt are not seen. For ye things yt are seen, are
temporal but they yt are not seen, are eternal

FOr we know, that if our 2. Cori. 4. b

For therefore do we sygh, desiring to be clothed with our habitacion that is
from heaven, Apo^ 3 d and.14. a

Petri. 1. c
this tabernacle, we do syghe being laden, because that we do not desire to be

But he yt does ordyne us thereto, it is god: Roma. 8. b 2. Cor. 1. c
which has given us ye earnest of ye sprete. Therefore are we always bold, and

wa^der through faith, not in sight.) But we are of good heart, and have a good
will rather to be absent from ye body, and to be present with ye Lord: and

3. a

The.vi. Chapter.
But we helping exhort you Esaias. 49. b
In a time acceptable have I herd ye, and in a day of salvation have I helped
ye. Behold, now is it an acceptable time, now is it a day of health. Be
geuynge unto no man any occasion of sto^blyng, yt our office be not blamed. But
in all things let us behave our selves 1. Cori. 4. a 2. Cori. 3. a
as ministers of god, in much patience, in tribulacio^s, in necessittes, in

vileness, by euel Esaias. 26. c
as dyenge and behold we live as being chastened, and not killed, as sorry and
yet always reioycynge, as having need and yet making many rych, as having
nothing and possessynge al things. Our mouth is open unto you o ye
Corinthians, our heart is enlarged. Ye are not in straytnesse for our sakes, but
ye are in straytnesse of your inward mocion. But I say unto you as unto
children having like reward: Set yourselues at large also Deuteronomy. 7. a

LEt us therefore ye most beloved having these promyses cleanse us from al

only in his coming, but 1. Pet. 2. c

affeccion is more plentifully toward you, reme^bryng the obedience of you all,

things I am bold to youwarde.

the handereachynge that is done unto ye saints. And not as we supposed, but

For ye know the liberalite of our LORD Jesus Christ, that for your sakes

of that which ye have. Luce. 2^. a

16. d

The.ix. Chapter.
Roma. 15. d 1. Cori. 16. a 2. Cori. 8. a
the handreachynge that is done unto ye saints, it is superfluous for me. For I

that Achaia was also ready se^ce ye year last past: and your fervent desire
has provoked many. But we have sent the brethren, that the thing whereof we

lest wha^ the Macedonia^s shall come with me and find you not ready, we, (I will
not say ye) be ashamed in this substance. Prou. 11. c Gal. ^. a
He that sows sparyngly, shall also reap sparyngly: and he yt sows in

knowlegyng of the Gospel of Christ, and the synglenesse of your distributynge
unto the^ and all men, and in their prayer for you, longing for you, because
of the abundaunte grace of God in you. I thank God for his vnoutspeakeable
gift.

The.x. Chapter.
ANd I myself Paul beseke For walkyng in the flesh, we do not war after the
flesh. For Ephe. 6. b
the weapens of our war are not fleshlye, but mighty before God to the
destruction of the strong holds, bringing to naught the counsels, and all
heyght auauncynge it self against the knowledge of God, and bryngyng in bondage
all understanding unto the obedience of Christ, and being ready to avenge
all disobedience, when your obedience shall be fulfilled. Look on the things
after the utter 2. Cor. 13. ^
the which the LORD has given us to your edifienge, and not destruction, I
will not be ashamed. But lest I should be supposed as to fraye you with letters,
(For letters say they are weyghty and strong, but ye presence of the body is
weak, and the speech unregarded,) let such one think this: that such as we
are in word by letters being absent, such [are we] also in the deed being
present. For we dare not interpryse or compare us with some which praise
themselves: but we are measurynge and comparynge ourselves by oureselues.
Ephesians. 4. a
measure, but according to ye measure of the rule, wherewyth god has
appointed unto us the rule to reach unto you. For we stretch not oureselues,
as not reachynge unto you: for we are come until you with the Gospel of
Christ. We are not reioycynge out of measure in other men's labors, but
having hope of your increasynge faith that it shall become great, according
to our rule in over flowynge, [by the same we intende] also to preach unto
the^ yt are beyond you: not [myndynge] to rejoice in the labors that are
prepared by another ma^s measure. But Esaias. 65. c Iere. 9. d 1. Cor. 1. d
he that rejoices let him rejoice in the LORD. For not he that Pro. 27. ^
prayseth himself is allowed, but he whom God prayseth.

The.xi. Chapter.
Would God ye would suffer Gene. 3. ^
as the serpent did begyle Eua with his craftynesse: eue^ so be your wits
corrupt also, and fall away from the synglenesse, that is in Christ Jesus.
Gala* ^
For if he that comes preaches another Christ, who^ we have not preached: or
if ye receive another sprete, whom ye have not received: or another Gospel,
which ye have not received, ye might right well have suffered it. For I
suppose me to have done nothing less than the high apostles. For though I am
rude in word, but not in knowledge. In all things I am manifest unto you. Or
have I sinned hu^blynge myself, yt ye should be e^alted? for I have preached
the Gospel ^
freely unto you? I have spoiled other congregacions, taking wages of them to do
service unto you. Actu. 20. c
And wha^ I was with you, and had need, I was chargeable unto noma^: For it that
Phil. 4. c
was wantyng unto me did the brethren supplye that came fro Macedonia: And in
all things I kept my self without charge, and I will so keep me. As truly as
the truth of Christ is in me, this reioycynge shall not be disanulled in me in
the regions of Achaia. Wherefore? because I do not love you? God knows. That I
do, and shall do, [I do it] that I may cut away the occasion of them that
covet an occasion: that where in they rejoice, they be found such as we also.
For such false apostles are deceatful workers tra^sfigurynge themselves into
messaungers of Christ. And no maruayle: For Satanas does tra^sfigure himself
into an angel of light. It is therefore no maruayle if his ministers be
transfigured, as ministers of righteousness, 2. Petri. 2. a
whose end shall beat you on the face. I say it after rebuke, as though we
had been weak on this behalf. Actu. 22. a Phil. 3. a
Wherein any dare be bold, (I speak it in foolyshnesse,) I dare be bold also.
They are Hebrews, I also. They are Israelites, I also. They are the sede of
Abraham I also. 1. Cori. 4. a
They are the ministers of Christ, I also. As a fool I speak it: I am more.
In many trauails, in presonmentes more abu^dauntly, in strypes above measure,
in deaths often. Of ye Jews have I received Deuteronomy. 25. a
five times forty strypes one less, Act. 16. d
I have thryse ben beaten with rods, Actu. 14. c
I have once been stoned, Act. 27. c
I have thryse suffered shipwreck, I have be^ night and day in the depth of
the Actu. 20. d
my daily combraunce, the care of all the congregacions. 1. Cori. 8.12
Who is weak, and I be not weak? Who is offended, and I burn not? If I must
rejoice, I will rejoice of the things yt are of my weakness. The God and
father of our LORD Jesus Christ, which is blessed for ever Gal. 1. c
knows that I lie not. Actu. 9. d
At Damascus, did the gouernoure of the people of king Aretas watch the city
of the Damascenes, that he might take me, and at a wyndow was I let down in a
basket through the wall, and so escaped I his hands.

The.xii. Chapter.
Ioh. 1. b
And lest the greatness of the reuelacions do exalte me, there is given unto
me the stynge of my flesh, the messaunger of Satanas, that he buffet me. For
ye which I have prayed the LORD thryse that he should depart fro me, and he
said unto me: My grace suffiseth the: for strength is made perfect by
weakness. I will therefore gladly rejoice in my sycknesses, that the power of
Christ may dwell in me. weak, than any I strong. I am become a fool, ye
have compelled me. For I ought to be praised of you 1. Cor. 9. a
seeing I have done nothing less, than they that are Apostles out of measure.
Although I am nothing, yet ar ye tokens of an apostle wrought upon you by all
patience, by tokens and wonders and powers. For what is it that ye have had
less than other congregacions, save that I myself have not ben chargeable
unto you? Forgive me this wrong. Behold this third time am I ready to come
unto you, and I shall not be grievous unto you. Actu. 20. c
For I seek not the things that be yours, but you. Another ought ye children to
gather treasure unto the elders, but the elders unto the children. And I will
very gladly bestow me, and will myself be bestowed for your souls, though I
loving you overmuch, be little loved Gala. 5. ^
lest happily there be among you stryfes, enuyes, hyghmyndes, debates,
backbytynges, whisperinges, swellings vprours, lest when I shall come again,
God bring me low among you, and I bewail many of them, which have sinned
before, and have not repented over their ^ Corin. 5. a
uncleanness and whoredom, and fylthynesse, that they have committed.

The.xiii. Chapter.
Deuteronomy. 19. c Mat. 18. b Ioha^. 8. b Heb. 10. c
In the mouth of two or three witnesses shall every matter stand. For I have
said before, and I tell you before as present, and now absente unto them that
have sinned before, and unto all the rest, that if I shall come again, I shall
not spare. Do ye seek the proof of him, Math. 10. c
which speaks in me, [namely] Christ: which is not weak among you, but is
mighty among you? For though he is crucified through weakness, yet lives he
by ye power of God. For we also are weak in him, but we live with him 1. Cor^.
^1. d
Prove ye your selves whether ye are in faith, make search of your selves.
Know not ye your selves yt Christ Jesus is in you? without happily ye be
castawayes. But I trust that ye do know it, for we are not castawayes. And we
pray God, that ye do no evil, not that we do seem alowable, but that ye do it
that good is, but that we be castawayes. For we can do nothing against ye
truth, but with the truth. For we rejoice yt we are weak, but ye are strong.
This also we wish, [namely,] your perfectness. And therefore do I wryt these
things being absente, that I being present, do not use myself hardlye,
according to the power, y^ 2. Cor. 10. b
the LORD has given me, to edifyenge, and not to destruction. Farthermore
brethren, rejoice, be Roma. 16. b
Salute each other with an holy kiss. All ye saints salute you. The grace of our
LORD Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and ye fellowship of the holy ghost
be with you all. Amen.

The end of ye second Epistle of Paul ye Apostle to the Corinthians.
The Epistle of the Apostle Paul to the Galathians.
The first Chapter.
Paul an Apostle not 1. Cor. 1. a Ephe. 1. a 1. Pet. 1. a
Grace be with you and peace from God our father, and our LORD Jesus
Christ, which has given him self for our sins, that he should draw us
out of this present evil world, according to the will of god and our father,
unto whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen. I maruayl that ye be so soon
turned from him, which has called you unto ye grace of Christ, unto another
Gospel: the which is nothing else, save that there be some that trouble you, and
A^tu. 15. a
will 1. Cori. 15. a
As we have said before, so say I again: If any man preach [ought] unto you,
beside it that ye have received, the same be cursed. But do I now speak fair
unto me^, or unto God? Do I seek to please men? Ioha^. 5. d and 12. f Jacob. 4.
a
If I did yet please men, I were not the servant of Christ. 1. Tes. 2 b
For I certifye you brethren of the Gospel, that is preached of me, that it is
not after man: for I did not receive it nor learned it of man, but by the
reuelacion of Jesus Christ. For ye have herd of my conversation sometime in
the Iewyship, that Actu. 8. a ^. a. 22. ^
I did persecute the congregation of God out of measure, and drove them out:
and how I prevailed in ye Iewyshyppe above many of my fellows in my nacyo^,
Ph^l. 3. a
being a more feruente lover of the tradicions of Actu. 9. b and.22. b
and had called me by his grace, that he might declare his son by me, that
I should preach him among the Gentyles, straight way did I not grant unto
Math. 16. c
flesh and blood, another did I come to Jerusalem, unto my predecessors ye
Apostles, but I went into Arabia, and am come again to Damascus. Afterward,
after three year, did I come to Jerusalem to se Peter, and I abode with him
fyftene days. I have seen none other of the Apostles, save Iams ye brother of
our LORD. The things that I write unto you, behold, 2. Cori. 11. d
God knows, for I lie not. After that did I come in the parts of Syria and
Cilicia: but of the face I was unknown of the congregation of Iewry, which
were in Christ. Nevertheless they had herd, that he that did sometime
persecute us, does now preach the faith, the which he destroyed sometime: and
in me they praised God.

The.ii. Chapter.
AFter that fourtene year, Actu. 15* ^
I went up to Jerusalem again, with Barnabas, Titus also being taken with me.
But I went up by reuelacion, and I did compare with the^ the Gospel that I do
preach among the Heythen: but specially them that seemed to be ought, lest I
should run or had run in vain. Actu. 16. a 1. Cori. 9. c
Nevertheless another Titus, which was with me, where as he was a Heythen, was
compelled to be circumcised. But because of certain false brethren preuelye
brought in, which came in secretly, to spy out our lyberte, the which we
have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into bondage: unto whom we gave
no rowme, no not for ye space of an hour, that the truth of ye Gospel do
remain with you. But as for the^ that did seem to be somewhat what they have been sometime, it makes not matter to me: Actu. 10. d Roma. 2. b Ephesians. 6. a
For God does not accept the person of a man For they yt seemed to be ought
auayled Actu. 9. d
they gave the ryghtha^des of fellowshippe unto me and Barnabas: that we among
the Heythen, but they among the circumcision, only that we should be
myndefull of ye poor: Actu. 15 c ^. Cori. 9. a
the which thing also I was careful to do. But when Peter came to Antioche, I
wythstode him in the face: for he was blameable. For before yt some did come
from James, he did eat with the Heythen. But when they were come, he wythdrew
and separated himself, fearyng the^ that were of the circumcision. And unto
his dissembling did the rest of the Jews consent, insomuche that Barnabas
also was drawn of them into the same simulacion. But wha^ I had seen yt they
did not walk ryghtly, after ye truth of ye Gospel, I said ynto Cephas before
all: If thou wha^ thou art a Jew, do live Heithenyshly, and not Iewishly,
how do you co^pel ye Heythe^ to live as ye Jews do? Phili. 3. a
We Jews by nature, and not sinners Romans 3. b
knowing yt a man is not justified by the works of the law, save by the
faith by Jesus Christ,) we also believe on Jesus Christ, that we may be
justified by ye faith of Christ, and not of ye deeds by ye law: because that
by ye deeds of the law shall not all flesh be justified. If we sekyng to be
made ryghteous in Christ, be found sinners also, is Christ ye minister of
sin? That be far. For if I buyld again ye things yt I have destroyed, I
make myself a trespasser. Romans 7. c
For by ye law am I dead unto ye law, yt I may live to God. With Christ am I
crucified. But now do not I live, but Christ lives in me. But that I live
now in the flesh, I live in the faith of ye son of God, Ephe. 5. a
which has loved, me, and has given himself for me. I cast not away the
grace of God. Gal. 5. a b
for if righteousness be by ye law, than dyed Christ for naught.

The.iii. Chapter.
O Ye wytlesse Galathians, Gala. 5. a
who has bewitched you not obey the truth? before whose eyes Christ Jesus was
despised, and among you crucified. This only would I learn of you: Have ye
received the sprete by the works of the law, or by the hearing of the faith?
Are ye so unwise that wha^ ye have begone by ye sprete, ye do now end by ye
flesh? Have ye suffered so great things in vain? if it be else in vain. He
therefore yt gave you ye sprete, and works miracles among you, [doth he it] by
ye deeds of the law, or by the hearing of the faith? As it is written: Genes.
15. b Roma. 4. a Jacob. 2. c
Abraham did believe God, and it was counted Gene. 12. a and.22. c
In the shall all nations be blessed. They therefore that are of faith, shall be
blessed with faithful Abraham. For they that are of the works of the law, are
under the curse. For it is written: D^u^t. 17. c
Cursed be every one that shall not abide in all things that are written in ye
book of the law, that he do them. But that noman is justified before God by
the law, it is manifest: for Abacuc. 2. a Roma. 1. b and.10. a
the ryghteous lives by faith. And the law is not of faith, Leui. 18. a
but he that shall do the^, shall live in them. Romans 8. a
Christ has redimed us from ye curse of the law, being become a curse for us,
(for it is written: Deuteronomy. 21. d
Cursed is every one that hangs on tree,) that among the Heythen the
blessing of Abraham should be in Christ Jesus, that we may receive ye promise
Heb. 9. c
the testament only of a man, being confirmed does noman despise or does add
thereunto. Unto Abraham and his sede were the promyses granted. He says not:
And in seeds, as in many seeds, but as in one: And thy sede which is Christ.
But this testament I say being confirmed by God, has not the law, Exodi.
12. f Judith. 5. b Actu. 7. a
which was given four hundredth and thyrty year after made of none effect, to
make the promise void. Romans 4. c
For if the enheritaunce be by the law, than is it not now of promise. But
unto Abraham has God given it by promise. Where to than does the law serve?
Romans 5. c 7. b. 8. c
It was ordyned because of transgression, until the sede should come, unto whom
he had promised it, being ordined by angels in the hand of the mediator. But
the mediator is not of one, but God is one. Is ye law Romans 3 b
But scripture closed all things under the law, that the promise of the
faith of Jesus Christ should be given unto the faithful. But before that the
faith did come, we were kept shut under the law, in the same faith, which
was to be disclosed. Therefore was ye law our scoolemayster unto Christ, that we
be justified by faith. But when the faith did come, we are not now under the
scoolemayster. Ioha^. 1. a
For ye be all the children of God by the faith, which is in Christ Jesus. Romans
6 a and.13. b Col. 2 b
For who so of you are baptized in Christ, ye have put on Christ. There is no
Jew another Greek: there is no bondmen, another fre: there is no man nor woman. For
ye are all Ioh. 17. c
one in Christ Jesus. Ephe. 1 b Hebre. 2. c
But if ye are Christ's, tha^ are ye the sede of Abraham, [and] according to
the promise, enheritours.

The.iiii. Chapter.
Ge^e. 49. b Dani. 9. d
the fullness of ye time was come, God sent his son borne of a woman, Mat.
5. b
put under the law, that he should redime them yt were under the law, that we
might receive the adopcion of the children. Roma. 8. b
And because ye be the children of God, God sent the sprete of his son in
your hearts, cryenge: Abba, father. Therefore is he not now a servant, but a
son. If he be a son an heir also through God. But tha^ truly not knowing
God, ye served them, 1. Cori. 8. a
that of nature are no Gods. But now that ye have known God, ye that ye are
known of God, Collo. 2. c
how do ye turn again to ye weak and beggerlye tradicions, unto the Mala. 1. a
an angel of God did ye receive me, [yee] as Christ Jesus. Where is therefore
your happiness? For I bear you record, that if it had been possible, ye had
put out your eyes and had given them unto me. Am I therefore become an enemy unto
you, telling you the truth? They are gelous over you amysse, but they will shut
you out, that ye be gelous over them. But covet ye always the good thing
fervently in goodness, and not only when I am present with you. My little
children of whom Ioha^. 16. c
I travail 1. Cor. 4. c
in birth again, until Christ be fashioned in you. I would be with you now
also, and change my voice: for I am ashamed of you. Tell me ye that will
Gene. 16. d
the one of a ha^demayden, Gene. 21. a
and one of her that was fre. Romans 9. a
But he yt was borne of the ha^demayde^, was borne after ye flesh: but he that
was borne of the frewoman, was after the promise: yt which things are spoken
by an allegory. For these are two testame^tes: The one truly on monte Sina,
engendrynge unto bondage, y^ which is Agar. For Sina is a mountain in Arabia,
which is joined unto it, that now is Jerusalem, and is in bondage with her
children. Apo. ^^ a
But that Jerusalem that is on high, is fre, which is our mother. For it is
written: Esaias. 54. a
Be glad thou bare^, which bear not: break forth and cry, which bryngest
forth: For the desolate has many mo children, than she that has a husband.
As for us brethren, we are ye children of promise after Isaac. Ge^e. 27. g
But as tha^ he that was borne after ye flesh, did pursue him that was borne
after the sprete: even so now also. But what says scripture? Gene. 21. b
Cast out ye hand maiden and her son: for the son of the handemayde^ shall
not be heir with the son of the frewoman. Therefore brethren are we not ye
children of the handemayden, but of the frewoman, with the which fredome Christ
has made us fre.

The.v. Chapter.
Esa. 9. a
the yocke of bondage. Behold I Paul tell you, that Actu. 15. a
if ye be circumcysed, Christ shall profit you nothing. And again I testifye
unto every man circumcisyng himself, that he is detter to keep ye whole law.
Ye are voyded from Christ, which are made ryghteous by the law, ye are fallen
from grace. For in sprete by faith we wait for the hope of righteousness.
Gal. 6. b
For in Christ Jesus does another circumcision avail ought, nor the foreskynne,
but faith, which 1. Cori. 13. a
works by charity. Ye ran well, Gal. 3. a
who has let you to obey the truth? Agree unto noman. This persuasion is not of
him, which does call you. 1. Cor. 5. a
A little leven sowreth the whole lompe of Iere. 23 Ezech. 3
judgment, what so ever he be. But if I brethren do yet preach the
circumcision, why do I yet suffer persecucio^? Tha^ is ye sklau^der of ye
cross voyded. Would God also they were cut away, which trouble you For ye
brethren are called unto a lyberte, only give not your Romans 14. a 1. Corin. 8 a
liberte into an occasion of ye flesh: but serve each other by the love of the
sprete. For all the law is fulfilled in one word: Leuit. 19. a Math. 19. c
and.22. d Romans 13. b
Thou shall love thy neighbor as thy self. If ye byte and eat one another,
take heed yt ye be not consumed of each other. I say in 1. Pet. 2. b
the lusts of the flesh. For ye flesh lusts against ye sprete, and the
sprete against the flesh. These are contrary to each other, yt the things that
ye will, ye do not the same. If so be ye are led by the sprete, ye are not under
the law. 1. Tim. 5. c
The deeds of the flesh are manifest, which are: fornicacion, uncleanness,
vnchastite, lechery, worship of Idols, wytchcrafte, 2. Cori. 12. c
debates, stryfes, hatredes, wrathes, chydynges, dissensions, sects,
enuyenges, manslaughters, dro^kennesses, bankettynges, and such like, the
which I tell you before, as I have said before: 1. Cori. 6. d Ephesians. 5. a Apo.
22. c
that they that do such, shall not obtain ye kingdom of heaven. Ephe. 5. b
But the fruit of ye sprete is: love, joy, peace, patience, gentlynesse,
goodness, lo^gesufferynge, softness, faith, meekness, temperau^ce, chastity.
1. Tim. 1. b
Against such is not the law. Ro^ 13. b 1. Pet. 2. b
But they that are Christ's, have crucified their flesh with the vices and
concupiscences. If we live in the sprete, let us also walk in the sprete. Let
us not become desirous of vain glory, provoking one another, enuyenge each
other.

The.vi. Chapter.
Ioh. 13. b Romans 15. a
Bear ye ye burdens one of another, and so shall ye fulfill the law of
Christ. For if any man thinks himself ought, when he is nothing, he
deceaueth himself. But let every man prove his own work, and so shall he
rejoice only in himself, and not in another Romans 14. b
for every man shall bear his own burden. Romans 15. d 1. Cori. 9. b
But let him that is instruct with the word, ministre of al his goods unto
him that does instruct him. Err not, God is not mocked. Luce. 16. d
For the things that a man shall sow, the same shall he reap also. For he
that sows in his flesh, of his flesh shall he also reap corrupcion: but he
that sows in the sprete of the sprete also shall he reap everlasting life.
2. Tes. 3. b
And doing good, let us not faynte: for at his time shall 1. Tim. 5. a
but most of all unto the householdes of faith. Behold with what letters I
have written unto you 1. Cori. 16. c
with mine own hand. For they that will please in ye flesh, they constrayne
you to be circumcised: only, that they suffer not the persecucion of the cross
of Christ. For another they yt be circumcised do keep the law: but they will
have you to be circumcised, that they may rejoice in your flesh. But far be
it fro me to rejoice, save in the cross of our LORD Jesus Christ, by ye
which the world is crucified unto me, and I unto the world. Gal. 5. a
For in Christ Jesus does another the circumcision avail ought, nor the
uncircumcision: but the new creature. Psalm. 124* a
And whosoever do follow this rule, peace be unto them and mercy, and upon the
Israel of God. From henceforth let noma^ trouble me, 2. Cori. 4. b
for I bear the marks of the LORD Jesus in my body. The grace of our LORD
Jesus Christ be with your sprete brethren. AMEN.

The end of the Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galathians.
The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians.
The first Chapter.
Paul an Apostle of Jesus 2. Cori. 4. a Gala. 1. a
Grace be unto you and peace from God our father and the LORD Jesus Christ. 1.
Pet. 1. a
Blessed be God and the father of our LORD Jesus Christ, which has blessed us
in every spiritual blessing in heavenly things in Christ, Ioha^. 15. b 2. Tim.
1. b
as he has chose^ us in him before the making of ye world, yt we should be
holy and unspotted in his sight in love: Which has predestinate us into the
adopcion of children through Jesus Christ in himself, according to the
purpose of his will, unto the praise of ye glory of his grace: In ye which he
has made us accepted in his Math. ^. b and.17. a
beloved son, Coll. 1. b Heb. 1. a
in whom we have redemption through his blood for the remission of sins,
according to the riches of his grace, which has been exceadynge plenteous in
us in all wisdom and prudence: Coll. 1. c
That he Gala. 4. a
the fullness of times to set up all things in Christ: things that be in
heaven and that be in earth, eue^ in himself in who^ also we likewise are
called by lot, Roma. 8. a
predestinate according to the purpose of him, which works all things after
the counsel of his own will, that we may be unto the praise of his glory:
Even we which before have hoped in Christ, In whom you also believed, when ye had
herd the word of truth, ye Gospel of your salvation, In whom also ye
beleuynge Romans 8. b 2. Cor. 1. c and.5. a
are sealed with the holy sprete of promise, which is the earnest of our
inheritance for the redemption of purchacynge unto ye Phili. 1. b Coll. 1. a
2. Tes. 1. b
Wherefore I also hearing your faith which is in Christ Jesus, and love unto all
saints, cease not geuynge thanks for you, making me^cyon of you in my
prayers, that the God of glory ( Ioh. 6. ^
the father of our LORD Jesus Christ) may give unto you the sprete of wisdom
and reuelacion for ye knowledge of him, the eyes of your heart being
lyghtened, yt ye may know which is the hope of his calling, and what be the
riches of the glory of his inheritance in the saints, and which is the
exceadynge greatness of his power toward us: which have believed according to
the workyng of the might of his power, which he has wrought in Christ Jesus,
raysynge him up from the dead, and Psalm. 109. a
setting him at his ryghthande in heavenly things, above all Dani. 10. b
rule and power and might, and dominion, and every name that is named not only
in this world, but also in ye world to come. Psalm 8. ^
And all things has he subdued under his fete, and made him Ephe. 4. b and.5.
c Col. 1 b
head over all the congregation, which is his body, and the fullness of him,
that fylleth all in all.

The.ii. Chapter.
ANd Collos. 1. b and.2. b
you has he quyckened, Coll. 3 a
In ye which also we all have led our co^uersacion sometime in the lusts of our
flesh, doing the will of the flesh and of the thoughts: And by nature were we
the children of wrath, even as well as other. But God which is rych in mercy,
for his exceadynge loves sake, wherwyth he has loved us when we were dead
also through sins, has quyckened us in Christ, Esa. 25. b Actu. 15. b
by whose grace ye are saved and has raised us up with him and made us to sit
with him in heavenly things in Christ Jesus: That in times to come he might
show the abundaunte riches of his grace in goodness upon us in Christ Jesus.
For by grace are ye saved through faith, and that not of your selves: For it is
the gift of God, not of works, lest any man should rejoice. Titu^. ^. b
in good works, which God has prepared, that we should walk in them.
Wherefore be ye myndefull, that sometime ye were Heythen in ye flesh, you which
were called uncircumcision from it that is called Phili. 3. a Collo. 2. b
circumcision made with hand in the flesh: You which in that time went
astraye without Christ, separated from the conversation of Israel, and
strangers of the Testame^tes, not having Romans 15. b
hope of the promise, and without God in this world: But now in Christ Jesus
ye that sometime went astraye afar of, are now made nigh in the blood of
Christ* For he is our Esaias. 9. b Col. 1* b
peace which has made both one, and broken down the myd wall of ye stop
even the enimities in his flesh, putting away by judgments ye law of the
commandments: That in himself he might make two in one new man, making
peace: that in one body he might reconcile both unto God through the cross,
killing the enemities in himself. And he coming Esaias. 57. c Luce. 2. b
has preached peace unto you which were afar of, and peace unto them that
were nigh. For by him have we both an intrau^ce in one sprete unto the father.
Johan. 1^. ^
Therefore are ye not now gestes and strangers, but ye are cytesens of the
saints and of the householde of God, builded upon 1. Corin. 3. b
the foundation of the Apostles and Prophets, 1. Petri. 2. ^
Jesus Christ being that hye corner stone, in whom every buyldyng being made,
grows in to an holy temple in the LORD, in whom ye also are builded together
into an habitacion of God in the holy ghost.

The.iii. Chapter.
FOr this things sake I Actu. 11. b
a presoner of Jesus Christ for you Heythen: If so be yet that ye have herd the
office of the grace of God, Actu. 1^. a and.22. b
which is given unto me among you: For according to Gala. 1. ^
reuelacion was the mystery declared unto me, as I wrote before in few words:
like as you reading may understand my prudence in ye mystery of Christ:
Which [mistery] in other generacions has not ben known unto the children of
men, as it is now opened unto his holy Apostles and prophets in ye holy ghost,
how yt the Heythe^ are like heirs, and of the same body, and like partakers
of his promise in Christ Jesus through ye gospel: whereof I am made a minister
according to the gift of ye grace of God which is given unto me, after ye
workynge of his power. For unto 1. Cor. 15. ^
the leest of all saints is this grace given: to preach among ye Heythen the
unsearchable riches of Christ, and to make al me^ se, what is ye commission of
Coll. 2. c
the mystery hyd (sense the world began) in God, which created all things:
that unto the rulers and powers in heavenly things might be known by the
congregation, the manyfolde wisdom of God, according to the eternal purpose,
which he has showed in Christ Jesus our LORD: In whom we have trust and
intraunce in boldness through the faith of him. Phili. 1. b 1. Tes. 3. a
Wherefore I desire that ye faint not in my troubles Coll. 1. c
for you, which

The.iiii. Chapter.
I Therefore a presoner in ye Gene. 17. a 1. Cori. 7. b Phil. 1. d Coll. 1. a 1.
Tes. 4* ^
that ye walk worthily of the calling where with ye are called, with all
humbleness and meekness, with patience, forbearyng one another in love,
being careful to keep the unite of the sprete in ye bo^de of peace. One body
and one sprete, as ye be called in one hope of your calling. One LORD, one
faith, one baptyme: One God and father of all, which is above all, and through
al, and in us all. Roma. 12. ^ 1. Cori. 12. a
But unto every one of us is given grace Ioh. 3. c
according to the measure of the gift of Christ. Wherefore he says: Psalm.
67. c Esaias. 45. a
He going up on hye, led away captivity captive: He gave gifts unto men.
That he went up, what is it, but that he also came down first into ye lower
parts of ye earth? Ioha^. 3. b
He that came down, the same is he that also went up above all the heavens, that
he might fulfill all things. 1. Cor. 12. c
And he made some truly Apostles, some prophets, some Evangelists, some
Shepeherdes and Teachers for the perfourmaunce of the saints in to the work
of the ministracion for the edifyenge of the body of Christ, till we al come
into the unite of faith and knowledge of the son of God: into a perfect man:
into the measure of the age of ye fullness of Christ. 1. Cori. 14. c
That we should not now be children, Col. 2. a
waueryng, and carried about with every wind of doctrine in the wyckednes of
me^ in sutylte, to the deceatfulnes of error. Ephe. 1. c and.5. c
which is ye head, eue^ Christ, of whom all the body being coupled and knyt
together through out every joint of Roma. 12. a 1. Cori. 1^. b
subministracion according to the operacion into the measure of every member
makes increace of the body to the edifyenge of it self in love. This I say
therefore and testifye in the LORD, that ye walk not now Roma. 1. c 1. Petr.
4. a
as the Heythen also do walk in the vanite of their own mind, having an
understanding blinded through darkness, being far from the way of God
through the ignorance that is in them because of the blyndnesse of their heart:
who falling into despair, have given over themselves to uncleanness, in the
workynge of Romans 6. a Coll. 3. a
Put ye of after the old conversation the old man, which is corrupt
according to the lusts of error: But be ye renewed in the sprete of your
mind, and put on a new man, which is shapen after God in righteousness and
holiness of truth. ^^ch. 8. c 1. Pet. 2. a
Wherefore putting away lyenge, speak ye the truth every man with his
neighbor, because we are members one of another. Psalm. 4. a
Be ye angrye, and sin not. Let not the Son go down upon your wrath. Give
not ye place to ye deuel. He yt did steal, let him now not steal: but rather
^. T^ss. ^. a
let him labor in workynge with his hands that which is good, that he may
have where of to give unto him that suffers need. Math. 1^. d Ephe. 5. ^
Let not every evil co^municacion proceed out of your mouth, but if any be
good to the edifyenge of faith, that it may give grace unto the hearers. And
grieve not ye the holy sprete of God, where in ye are 2. Corin. 1. c
sealed against the day of redemption. Let all bytternesse, and wrath, and
indignacion, and co^playnynge, and blasphemye be removed away from you with
all malice. Col. 3 b
But be courteous one to another, merciful, Mat. 6. b
forgeuyng one another, like as God also has forgeuen you in Christ.

The.v. Chapter.
BE ye therefore Mat. 5. c Ioh. 13. b
the followers Gala. 1. ^ Ephe. 5. c
given over himself for us an oblacion and sacrifyce unto God into an odoure
of swetnesse. As for fornicacion and all uncleanness or covetousness, Exodus
23. b
let it not be named among you, as it becomes saints: or Eccli^. 23. c
fylthynesse, or foolysh talking, or jesting which things pertayne not to
the matter, but rather giving of thanks. 1. Cori. 6. b Col. 3. a
For understanding be ye sure of this, yt every fornicatour, or unclean person,
or covetous person which is a service of Idols has not inheritance in ye
kingdom of Christ, and of God. Coll. 2. ^
Let noman deceive you with vain words. For because of these things comes
the wrath of God upon the children of unbelief. Be not ye therefore partakers
of the^: For ye were sometime darkness, ^. Tessa. 5. a
but now light in the Gala. 5. c
for the fruit of light is in all goodness, and righteousness, and truth)
proving what is well pleasyng unto God: And have not ye fellowshippe with the
unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprove them. For it is shame also
to speak what things are done of them in secret. Ioha^. 3. c
But al things are manifest that are rebuked of the light. For every thing yt
is manifest, is light. Wherefore he says: Esaias. 60. a Romans 13. b
Up thou that slepest, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall give the
light. Coll. 4. a
Take heed therefore brethren how ye walk circu^spectly, not as the unwise,
but as ye wise, redeminge ye time, for the days are euel. Wherefore be not ye
unwise, but understanding what is Roma. 12. a 1. Tess. 4. a
the will of God. And Eccli^. ^1. c
be not ye dro^ken with wine wherein is voluptuousness, but be ye Actu. 2. b
filled with the holy ghost, Col. 3. ^
talking unto your selves in psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, Psalm. 97. a
singing and playenge in your hearts unto the LORD, 1. Tess. 5. c
geuynge thanks always unto God and the father for all things in ye name of our
LORD Jesus Christ: submyttyng yourselues one to another in ye fear of Christ.
Coll. 3. c 1. Petri. 3. a
Let ye weme^ be in subjection to their husbands as to ye LORD: 1. Cor. 11. a
for ye husband is the head of the woman, as Christ is ye head of ye
co^gregacio^. HE is ye savior of his body. But like as the congregacyon is
subject unto Christ, so let ye weme^ be also to their husbands in all
things. Ye men, love your wives, as Christ also loved the congregation, and
Ephes^. 5. a Gala. 1. a
gave him self for it, that he might sa^ctifye it, Titum. 3. a 1. Petri. 3. c
clensynge it with the fou^tayne of water in the word of life: that he might
make it unto himself a glorious congregation not having blemysh or wrynkle,
or any such thing, but that it might be holy and undefiled. Even so ought me^
also to love their wives as their own bodies. He that loves his wife, loves
himself: For noma^ has hated his own flesh at any time, but does noryshe and
cherysh it, even as Christ does also the congregation: For we be members of
his body, of his flesh and of his bones. Genes. 2. d Math. 19. a Marci. 10. a
For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and cleue unto his
wife, and they shall be two in one flesh. This is a great mystery. But I say in
Christ and in the congregation. Nevertheless you also let every one love his
wife as himself: but let the wife fear her husband.

The.vi. Chapter.
YE Coll. ^. c
children, obey your Exodi. 20. b
Honor thy father and thy mother, (which is the first co^mau^demente in the
promise,) that thou may prospere and live long upon earth. And ye fathers
provoke not your children unto wrath, but Exodi. 11. d Deute. 4. b 6. d. 11. c
Psalm. 77. ^
bring them up in the nurtoure and informacion of the LORD. Col. 3. ^ Titum.
2. b 1. Pet. 2. c
Ye servants, obey your bodily masters with fear and trembling in the
symplenesse of your heart, as unto Christ: Not serving unto the eye, as
pleasynge men, but as the servants of Christ, doing ye will of God from the
mind with good will, doing service as unto the LORD and not unto men:
knowing that every man what good thing so ever he does, shall receive the same
of the LORD, whether he be bond or fre. Eccli. ^5. d Coll. 3 c
And you masters, do ye even the same unto them, putting away threatenynges:
knowing that both their LORD and yours is in heaven, Actu. 10. d Roman 2. b
Collos. 3. c ^. Pet. 5. b
and there is no accepting of persons with God. Finally brethren, be ye
strong in the LORD, Exodus 28. a Deuteronomy. 23. b Psalm. 13^. a Esaias. 11. a Sap. 5.
c 2. Cori. 10. a
Sto^de ye therefore being gyrded about your loins in truth, and having on
the brestplate of righteousness, and your fete shod into the preparynge of
the Gospel of peace: In all things taking the shylde of faith, where with ye
may quench all the fyry darts of the most wicked. Take ye also the helmete
of salvation and Heb. 4. c
the swearde of the Luce. 18. a 1. Tess. 5. c
Prayenge by all manner of prayer and supplicacion always in ye sprete, and
watchynge in the same in all instaunce and supplicacion for all saints and for
me, Collo. 4. a 2. Tess. 3. a
that the word may be given me in the opening of my mouth with boldness, to
declare the mystery of the Gospel, for ye which I am a messaunger in this
cheyne, so Actu. 4. c
that in it I may be bold to speak as I ought. But yt ye also may know the
things that are about me, what I do, Tichicus ye most dear brother and
faithful minister in the LORD, shall show you all: Whom I have sent unto you
for the same purpose, that ye may know ye things that are about us, and
that he may comfort your hearts. Peace be unto the brethren and love with
faith from God our father and the LORD Jesus Christ. Grace be with all them
that love our LORD Jesus Christ syncerely. Amen.

The end of the Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians.
The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians.
The first Chapter.
Paul and Timothe the Actu. 16 b
Philippis, with the bishops and Actu. 6. ^
ministers, 2. Cor. 1. a
grace be unto you and peace from God our father, and the LORD Jesus Christ.
I Coll. 1. a 1. Tes. 1. a
thank my God in every remembrance of you, making always in all my prayers
instaunte prayer for you with joy concerning your fellowshippe in the
Gospel of Christ, from the first day hitherto: trusting of that one, that he
that has begone in you Ioha. 6. d
ye good work, shall fule^de it until the day of Christ Jesus, as it is due
unto me to think that of you all, because I have you all partakers of my joy
in my heart, and in my bands, and in my defense and confirmacion of the 1.
Tess. 2. a
record how I do long for you all even from the heart root in Jesus Christ.
Ephe. 1. c Col. 1. a 2. Tess. 1. b
And this I pray, that your love may increace more and more in all knowledge,
and in all understanding, that ye may allow the best, that ye may be pure and
without offense against the day of Christ, filled with ye frut of
righteousness through Jesus Christ unto the glory and praise of God. Ephe. 3.
b
But I would have you to wit brethren, that the things that are about me
were more ^or ye profit of the Gospel, insomuche that my bands were made
manifest in Christ in every judgment house, and in all other [places:] so
that many of the brethren having the more trust in the LORD by my bands,
they were bold more plentyfully without fear to speak ye word of God. Some
truly, both for envy and strife: but some preach Christ for good will: but
some of love, knowing yt I am laid here for the defense of the Gospel: but
some show Christ of contencion not syncerely, supposing them to raise
persecucio^ unto my bo^des. What tha^? when by every 2. Cor. 1. b
by your prayer, and the ministracio^ of ye sprete of Jesus Christ, according
to my waiting for and hope, that I shall be ashamed in nothing, but with all
boldness, as always so shall now also Christ be magnifyed in my body, either
through life or death. For Christ is life unto me and death auau^tage. If to
live here in the flesh, is the fruit of my labor what I shall chose also I can
not tell. But I am in distress with two things, 2. Cor. 5. a
having a desire to be lowsed, and to be with Christ, the which is much more
better: but to abide in ye flesh is necessary for your sakes. And Ephe. 4. a
Col^. 1. a 1. Tess. 4. a
worthy of the Gospel of Christ, that whether I shall come, and shall se you:
or being absente I shall hear of you that ye stand steadfast in one sprete,
labourynge together one minded in the faith of the Gospel, and that in
nothing ye be afraid of the adversaries: the which is unto them an occasion
of perdicion, but unto you of salvation, and that of God. For unto you it is
given for Christ's sake, not only that ye should believe in him, but that ye
also suffer for him, having like fight, as ye saw in me also, and now hear
of me.

The.ii. Chapter.
Roma. 12. c
that ye do mind one thing, having one love, of one mind, meaning one
thing: let nothing [be done] through 2. Cor. 3. a
strife nor vain glory, but in humblynesse, estymynge each the superiores of
other, every one considering not the things yt be theyrs but the things of
other. 1. Pet. 2. c
Let that mind be in you, yt which was also in Christ Jesus, the which when he
was in ye shape of god, he thought it no robbery to be equal with God, Psalm. 8.
b
but he made himself of no reputacion, taking upon him the shape of a
servant, Hebr. 5. a
was made in ye likeness of men, and in apparel he was found as a man: he
did humble himself, and became obedient until death, even the death of the
cross. Math. 28. c Heb. 2. b
For yt which cause God did also exalte him, and gave him a name, yt which is
above every name, Esaias. 54. c Dani. 7. c Romans 14. b
that in ye name of Jesus every ane be bowed, of things in heaven, of things
in earth, and of things under ye earth, and that every tu^ge do knowledge, that
the LORD Jesus Christ is in ye glory obeyed, Actu. 16 b
not only in my presence, but much more now in mine absence, work your health
with fear and tremblyng. Deuteronomy. 8. d Ezech. 36. ^ 2. Cor. 3. a Hebr. 13. d
For it is God that works in you both to will and to perform, after ye good
will. But 1. Pet. 4. b
do ye al things without grudgynges and doutynges, yt ye be without co^playnt
and simple children of God, 1. Pet. 2. ^
without rebuke in the myddest of ye evil and perverse generation: Math. 5. b
among yt which ye shine as lyghtes in ye world, holding fast the word of
life unto my 2. Cor. 1. c 1. Tess. 2. c
reioycyng in ye day of Christ, because I have not run in vain, another
have I labored in vain. Col. 1 c
But although I am offered up upon ye sacrifice and willing service of your
faith, Roma. 1^. b
I am glad, and rejoice with you all: Be ye glad also of the same, and rejoice
with me. I trust in the LORD Jesus Actu. 16. a
to 1. Tess. ^. b
that I also may be of good comfort, knowing the things yt are about you.
For I have noman so one minded, which be careful for you with sincere
affeccion. 1. Cori. 1^. ^
For they al seek the things that be theyrs, not that be Jesus Christ's. But
ye know the proof of him, for as a child unto the father, so did he serve
with me in the Gospel. The Same therefore do I trust to send unto you as soon
as I shall se to the things that are about me. Philip. 1. ^
But I trust in the LORD, that I myself also shall come shortly unto you.
Nevertheless I thought it expediente to send the brother Epaphroditus, my
fellow workman and fellowsouldyer, but your Apostle, and the servant of my
need: for he longed for you all, and was sorry because ye had herd him to have been sick. For he was sick until death, but God has had mercy upon him: and
not only upon him, but also of me, lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow. I
have sent him therefore the more spedely, that wha^ ye have seen him, ye may
be joyful again, and that I be without heaviness. Receive him therefore in the
LORD with all gladness, Mat. 10. a Romans 15. d 1. Tes. 5. c
and have such in honor: for he went to even until death because of the
work of Christ geuyng over his life, that he might fulfill it that was wantyng
unto you toward my willing service.

The.iii. Chapter.
Esa. 56. c Phili. 1. b
Beware of dogs, beware of euel workmen, beware of division. Romans 2. c Col^.
2. b
For we are the circumcision, even we which serve God Ioha^. 4. c Romans 1. a
in the sprete, and rejoice in Christ Jesus, and not having confidence in the
flesh: though I also have confidence in the flesh. 2. Cor. 12. a
If any other man seems to have confidence in the flesh, I have it more being
circumcised the eight day, of the nacio^ of Israel, of the trybe of Benjamin,
an Hebrew of the Hebrews, after the law, Actu. 23* a 26. a. 28. c
a Pharise: after the ferue^tnes, Actu. 9. c Gala. 1. b
I was persecutyng the congregation of God: according to the righteousness
which is in the law, I have walked without blame. Math. 13. f
But the things that were advantage unto me, the same have I counted loss for
Christ's sake. Nevertheless I count all things to be loss, because of the
exceadyng Johan. 17. a Col. 2. a
knowledge of Jesus Christ my LORD, for whose sake I have counted Romans 6. a
being like fashioned with his death, if by any means I may attain unto the
resurreccion that is from the dead. Not that I have attained unto it already,
or yt I be now perfect: but I follow upon if by any mean I may co^prehende,
wherein I am co^prehe^ded of Christ Jesus. Brethren I suppose me not to have
gotten hold. But one thing [I do:] forgetting the things truly that are
behind, but stretchyng myself to ye things before, I preasse to ye appointed
mark, to ye reward of the high calling of god in Christ Jesus. Let us therefore
as many as are 1. Cor. 4. c and.10. d
Be ye my followers brethren, and mark the^ that walk so, as ye have our
ensample. For many do walk the which I have often told you (^ut now I also
tell it you weeping) [to be] the enemies of the cross of Christ, whose end is
death R^^. 16. b
whose God is the belly, and their glory in shame, which do mind earthly
things. Col. 3. a
But our conversation is in heaven, from whence also we do wait for the
saueoure the LORD Jesus Christ, ^. Cori. 15. f
which shall restore our vile body, being like fashioned unto his clear
body: according to the workynge, of his power, by the which also he may be
able to subdue all things unto him self.

The.iiii. Chapter.
1. Cor. 9. a
yockefellowe, help those women which have labored with me in the Gospel,
with Clement and mine other helpers, Luce. 10. b Apo. 17. b
whose names are in the book of life. 1. Tess. 5. c
Rejoice ye in ye LORD always, again I say, rejoice. Let your softness be
known unto all men, for the LORD is nigh. Be nothing careful, but in every
prayer and suplicacion, let your requests be known unto God with
thankesgeuynge. And Ioh. 14. c Roma. 5. a
the peace of God which passes all understanding whatsouer things are ^ust,
whatsoever things are holy, whatsoever things are loving, whatsoever things
are of good report, if there be any virtue, if there be any praise of learning,
of these things be myndefull. The things yt ye have both learned and
received, and have herd, and have seen in me, do the same, and the God Esaias.
9. b.
of peace shall be with you. But I rejoice greatly in the LORD, that at the last
ye are floryshynge again to regard me, as ye regarded me: but ye were
occupied. I say it not as because of need: for I have learned in what cases yt
I am, ^. Tim. 6. ^.
to be content. I can both be low, and I can be full. I am taught every where
and in all things, to be satisfied, and to be hongry, and to be ouerflowynge,
and to suffer scarceness: I can do all things in him that comfort me.
Nevertheless ye have done well bearing part with my tribulacio^. But ye
Philippians Romans 1^. a. Hebr. 1^. c.
an acceptable offering, pleasynge unto God. My God acco^plysh every request
of yours, according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus. Unto God and our
father be praise for ever and ever. Amen. Salute every saint in Christ Jesus.
The brethren that are with me salute you. All the saints salute you, but
specially they that are of Cesars householde. The grace of our LORD Jesus
Christ be with your sprete. AMEN.

The end of the Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians.
The Epistle of the Apostle Paul to the Colossians.
The first Chapter.
Gal. 1. ^. Ephesians. 1. a
Grace be unto you and peace from God our father. Phil. 1. a. ^. Te^s. 1. a.
We give thanks unto god and the father of our LORD Jesus Christ, prayeng
always for you (hearing your faith in Christ Jesus, and the love that ye have
toward all saints,) because of the hope that is laid up for you in the
heavens: the which ye have herd in ye word of truth of the Gospel, the
which is come unto you, as it is also in ye whole world: Marci. 4. a
and brings fruit and grows, as it does also among you, sense that day yt
ye have herd and known the grace of God in the truth: as ye have learned it
of Col^. 4. b
Epaphras our most beloved fellow servant, which is a minister of Christ
Jesus for you, which also has showed unto us your love in the sprete. Ephe. 1.
c. Phil. 1. b. 2. Tess. 1. b.
Therefore we also, sense the day that we herd of it, cease not prayenge for
you and axyng that ye may be filled with the knowledge of 2. Tess. 4. a.
his will, in all spiritual wisdom and understanding: that ye may Philip. 1.
d.
walk worthily, pleasynge God in all things, Ioh. 15. ^.

which has made us worthy of the part of the enheritaunce of saints in the
Ephesians. 1. ^.
by who^ we have redemption and remission of sins, 2. Cor. 4. ^. Heb. 1. a.
which is ye image of.1. tim 9. c.
the invisible God, ye fyrstborne of every creature Psalm. 32. a Heb. 1. a.
for by him are all things made both in heaven and in earth, the visible
things and invisible, whether they be trones, or dominions, or rules or
powers: all things are created by him and in him, and he is before all, and
all things abide in him. Ephesians. 1. c. and.4. b.
And he is ye head of ye body [namely] the congregation, Apoc. 1. a.
which is the beginning, 1. Co. 15. c
the first begotten from the dead, yt he be having the primacy in all things:
For it has pleased all Coll. 2. b
fullness of the Godheade to dwell in him, and Romans 3. c. 1. Cor. 5. c

2. a Coll. 2. b.
And you when ye were sometime made strange and enemies, your wit being
given to evil works, but now has he reconciled you in the body of his flesh

among every creature that is under heaven, whose minister am I Paul become,

do now rejoice in my sufferynges for you Ephe. 3. b Phili. 2. a. 2. Tim. 2. a.

given me among you, that I do fulfill the word of God, Ephesians. 3. b.
the mystery that was hyd from everlasting and unto the generacions: but is
now Math. 11. ^. Ioh. 6. c. 2. Cor. 2. c. Eph^^. 1. b.

the glory of this secret among the Heythen, the which thing is Christ
among you, the hope of glory, whom we show, rebukynge every man, and
teaching every man in all wisdom, that we may make every man perfect in
Christ Jesus: wherein also I labor, stryuyng according to his workynge,
which he works in me by power.

I Would have you to know Ioh. 17. a

in whom are hyd all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge. But Ephesians. 5. a.

For though I am absent from you in body, but yet am I present with you in
sprete reioycynge and seeing your order, and the steadfastness of that faith of
yours, which is in Christ Jesus. Gal. 3. ^.
As ye have therefore received ye LORD Jesus Christ, walk in him, being both
rooted and builded in him: and being stablyshed in faith as ye have also
learned, so be ye plenteous in geuynge of thanks Romans 16. b
Take heed lest any man deceive 1. Cori. 5. c
For in him dwells all Ioh. 1. b.
fullness of the Godheade bodily, and ye are filled in him, which is the head
of al rule and power, in whom also ye are circumcised Romans ^. c. Philip. ^. ^
with a circumcision not made with hands in robbynge of ye body of flesh, but
in ye circumcision of Christ, Roma. 6. a
being buried with him in baptyme, in the which ye are risen also by the faith

1. b
You also wha^ ye were dead in sins and in the foreskynne of your flesh,

14. a
Let noma^ miscarye you willing in humblynesse and Math. 22. c
deuocio^ of angels, ye things that he has not seen, walking in vain,
being pufte up in ye meaning of his flesh, and not holdyng of the head, of
whom the whole body being noryshed fastened together by knottes and joints
does grow to the greatness of God. Gala. 4. ^
If ye therefore are dead with Christ from the ordinances of the world, what
do ye yet use decrees as living in the world? Touch ye not, another tayst ye,
another handle ye, which things do all hurt with the very use, after the
commandments and doctrines of men: 1. Tim. 4. b.
which in deed have a shine of wisdom in supersticion and humblynesse, and
in not sparing the body, countyng it not worthy of any honor unto the
sufficiency of the flesh.

The.iii. Chapter.
IF ye are therefore risen with Ephes^. 1. ^ Heb. 1. a. 10. b. 12. a
the ryghthande. Set your minds on those things that are above, not those yt
are upon earth. For ye are dead, 1. Petri. 1. a
and your life is hyd with Christ in God. Phili. 3. c Ioha. 3. c
But when Christ your life shall appear, than shall ye also appear in glory

for the which things the wrath of god does come upon the children of

in ye which things ye walked sometime, when ye did live in them. Romans 6. a
Ephesians. 4. c
But lay ye away now all things, wrath indignacion, maliciousness,
blasphemy, fylthy co^municacio^ out of your mouth. Lie not one to another,
Roma. 1^. b
robbynge yourselues of the old man with his deeds, and putting on ye new man,
which is renewed into knowledge, according to his likeness, which has shape^
him: Gala. 6. b
where there is no man and woman, no Heythe^ and Jew, circu^cisio^ and the
foreskynne, Barbarus and Scitian, bond and, fre, but Christ is al in all.
Ephe. 4. a
Put ye on therefore as elect other, and forgeuynge among your selves if any
have a complaynte against another: and as the LORD has forgeuen you, so do ye
also. And above all these things have Math. 22. b
love, which is ye band of perfection, and ye peace of Christ rejoice in your
hearts, unto the which also ye are called in one body, and be thankful. Let
the word of Christ dwell plenteously in you, in all wysedom, Epes. 5. ^.
teaching and exhorting yourselues in psalms and songs of praise, and
spiritual songs, singing graciously unto the LORD in your hearts. 1. Cor.
10. d
All what soever ye do in word or deed, do all things in the name of our LORD
Jesus Christ, Ephesians. 5. c. ^. Petri. 3. a
geuyng thanks unto God and the father by Ephesians. 6. a.
Ye children obey your fathers and mothers in all things, for that is
pleasynge unto the LORD. Ye fathers provoke not your children unto anger, that
they wax not feeble minded. Ephesians. 6. a. Titum. 2. b ^. Pe^ri. 2. c
Ye servants obey your bodyly masters in all things, not serving to the
eye, as pleasynge men, but fearing the LORD in synglenesse of heart. What
soever ye do, do it hartelye, as unto the LORD, and not men: knowing that ye
shall receive of the LORD the reward of the enheritaunce. Serve the LORD
Christ. Romans ^. a.
For who so does wrong, he shall receive it that he has done wrong, Act. 10.
d. Romans 2. b*
and there is no respect of persons with God.

The end of the Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Collossians.
The first Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians.
The first Chapter.
1. Cori. ^* ^. Gala. 1. a.
Grace be unto you and peace. Phili. 1. a Coll. 1. a
We thank God always for you all, making mention of you in our prayers without
ceassynge, calling to mind the work of your faith, and the labor, 1.
Tessa. 4. b
and the love, and the waiting of the ^. Tim. 1. a
hope of our LORD Jesus Christ, before God and our father. We knowing
brethren beloved of God your eleccion 1. Cor. 2. a. and.4. c.
for our Gospel was not unto you in word only, but also in power and in the
holy ghost, and in much fullness, 1. Tess. 2. a
as ye know what manner of men we have been among you for your sakes. And ye
are become our followers Act. 1. b.
from ye heavens, (who^ he raised from the dead,) even Jesus, which has
drawn us out of Ioh. 3. ^.
the wrath to come.

The.ii. Chapter.
FOr ye brethren do also many things before, and Actu. 16. c
shamefully entreated (as ye know) at Philippos, we were boldened in our God
Act. 17. a.
to speak unto you the Gospel of God in great carfulness. For our
exhortacion was not of error, nor of uncleanness, nor in deceate: but as we
are allowed of God, that the Gospel should be committed unto us, even so speak
we: Gal. 1. b
not as pleasynge men, but God, which tries our hearts. For we never went
about with flatteryng words (as ye know,) nor with occasion of covetousness
( Philip. 1. b.
God is record,) nor sekyng praise of men, another of you, nor of other, when
we might have been chargeable unto you as Apostles of Christ: but we Act. 20.
e. 2. Cor. 4. b 2. Tess. 5, a.
workynge night and day, lest we should be chargeable unto any man, we
preached among you the Gospel of God. Ye are witnesses and God, how holyly
and justly, and without blame we have been by you which have believed: as ye know
how we besekynge every one of you (as a father his children) and comfortynge
you, we have wytnessed unto you, 1. Tess. 4. ^.
that ye would walk worthily unto God, which has called you into his kingdom
and glory. Therefore do we also give thanks unto God without ceassynge,
because when ye had received of us ye word of the preaching of God, ye
received it not as the word of men, but (as it is truly) the word of God,
which works in you that have believed. For ye brethren are become Heb. 10. d.
the congregacions of God, that are in Iewry in Christ Jesus. For ye also have
suffered the same things of your companions, as they also of the Jews, which
have killed both the LORD Jesus, and the prophets, and have persued us, and
do not please God, and be contrary to al me^, Act. 17. a. b
forbyddynge us to speak unto the Heythen that they may be saved, that they
may always fulfill their sins: for ye wrath of God is come upon the^ until
ye end. But we brethren being wythdrawe^ from you for the space of an hour,
from syghte, not ye heart, we haisted more spedely to se your face, with great
desire: For we would once again have come unto you, verily I Paul, Dan. 10. b.
but satanas did let us. For which is our hope, or 2. Cor. 2. b. Philip. 2. b
joy, or crown of glory? Are not ye it before our ORDE Jesus Christ in his
coming? For ye are our praise and joy.

The.iii. Chapter.
Wherefore we forbearing no Act. 17. c.
Athens, and we sent Timothe our brother and minister of God in the Gospel of
Christ, to stablysh you, and to exhort you for your faith, Ephesians. 3. b.
that noman be moved in these tribulacyons: Ioh. 15. b. 2. Tim. 3. b.
for ye youreselues do know that we are ordyned thereto. For wha^ we were with
you, we showed unto you, that we should suffer tribulacions, as it is come to
pass also, and ye know it. Wherefore I also not forbearynge any longer, I have
sent to know your faith, lest happily he that tempts have tempted you,
and our labor become

The.iiii. Chapter.
of us how ye ought to Philip. 1. d.
walk and to please God, that ye do so walk, that ye may be more
plentyfullyer. For ye know what commandments I have given you by our LORD
Jesus. For this is Romans 12. a. Ephesians. 5. b.
the will of God [namely] your hallowynge, that ye abstain yourselues from
fornicacio^, yt Tob. 6. d. 1. Cor. 7. a.
every one of you know how to possess your vessel in holiness and honor,
not in ye lust of co^cupisce^ce Roma. 1. c.
as the Heythen also, which know not God, and that noman pass his bonds,
another begyle his brother in bargenynge. For the LORD is the auenger of all
these things, as we have said unto you before and have wytnessed: For God
has not called us unto uncleanness, but unto hallowynge. Wherefore, Luce. 10. b*
he that despyseth these things, despyseth not man, but God, 1. Cor 3. b.
and.6. c.
which also has given his holy sprete in us. 1. Tess. 1. a.
But of the love of brotherheade is Ioh. 6. a.
for ye your selves have learned of God that ye love each other. For ye do it
toward all the brethren in whole Macedonia. But we pray you brethren, that ye
be more abundaunte, and that ye endeavor to be quiet, and that ye do your
business, Act. 20. c. 2. Tess. 3. a.
and do work with your hands, as we have commanded you, that ye also may
walk honestly toward them that are without, and desire not ought of any
ma^s. But we will not have you to be ignorant brethren of them that be
slepynge, yt ye be not sorrowful as the other also, Sap. ^. ^*
which have no hope. For if we believe that Jesus dyed and rose again, so shall
God bring them also with him, which have slepte through Jesus. For this we say
unto you on ye word of the LORDS behalf: 1. Cor. 15. f
That we yt live, which remain, unto the coming of the LORD we shall not
preuente the^ that have slepte. Mat. 24. c. Ioh. 5. c. Act. 1. b. 2. Tess. 2. a.
For the LORD himself shall come down from heaven with a commandment and
with the voice of the Archangell, and with ye trompe of God: and the dead that
are in Christ shall rise first. After that we that live, which are left
over, shall be caught up together with them into ye air, to mete Christ in the
air, and so shall we be ever with the LORD. Wherefore comfort you each other
with these words.

The.v. Chapter.
Mat. ^4. d. 2. Pet. 3. b. Apo. 3. a.
the day of the LORD as a thief in the night, so shall it come. For when they
shall say: It is peace and safety, Iere. 1^. b.
than shall a soden destruction come upon them, even as the pain of her that
is great with child, and they shall not escape it. But ye brethren are not in
darkness that that day should overtake you as a thief. For ye are all the
children of light, and the chylderen of the day, we are not of the night
another of the darkenesses. Romans 13. b.
Let us therefore not sleep as the other also, but let us watch and be sobre. For
they that sleep, sleep in the night: and they that be dronken, are dronke^ in
the night. But let us that are of the day be sobre, Esa. 5^. c Ephesians. ^. b
armed with the brestplate of faith and love, and the helmet the hope of
salvation. For God 2. Cor. ^. ^
whether we do wake or sleep, we may live together with him. Wherefore comfort

that ye know them that labor among you, and have ouersyghte of you in the

comfort the feeble minded, take up the weak, be pacie^t toward al me^. Mat. 5.

The end of the first Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians.
The second Epistle of the Apostle Paul to the Thessalonians.
The first Chapter.
2. Cor. 1. a Ephesians. 1. a
Grace be unto you and peace from God our father, and the LORD Jesus Christ. We
ought to give always thanks unto God for you brethren, even as it is
convenient, because your faith increases, and the love of every one of you is
plenteous toward each other: insomuche, that we our selves also do rejoice of
you in the co^gregacions of God, for your patience and faith in all your
persecucions and troubles, the which ye suffer for an ensample of ye just
judgment of God, yt ye may be counted worthy in ye kingdom of Mat. 24. c
and.25. c
unto the reuelacion of the LORD Jesus from heaven with the angels of his power
in 2. Pet. 3. a
ye flame of fire, geuynge vengeance unto them which have not known God,
Rom^ 2. a
and that do not obey the Gospel of our LORD Jesus Christ, the which Sapi.
5.
shall suffer everlasting punishmente in death, Esaias. ^. b
from ye face of ye LORD, and from the glory of his power, wha^ he shall come to
be glorified in his saints, and to be made wonderful in all the^ yt have
believed, because yt our witness upon you was believed in yt day: In the which
thing also Coll. 1. ^
we pray always for you, yt our God will wit safe you of his calling, yt he
fulfill all the will of his goodness, and the work of faith in power* that the
name of our LORD Jesus Christ be praised among you, and you in the same,
according to the grace of our God, and the LORD Jesus Christ.

The.ii. Chapter.
WE beseke you brethren by 2. Petri. ^. a
as though the day of the LORD were at hand. Let noman deceive you by any
means for [the LORD comes not] except Dan. 9. ^. 1. Tim. 4. a
the departing come first, and the sinful man be disclosed, the child of
perdicion, which Luc. 11. c
wythstandeth, and is exalted above all that is God, or that is worshipped:
insomuch that he do sit 1. C^r. 3. b and.6. c
in the temple of God, Dan. 11. ^
showing him as though he were God. Do not ye remember ye wha^ I was yet with
you, I told you these things? And now ye know what does wytholde, that he
may be disclosed at his time. ^. Ioh. 2. c
For the mysterye of iniquite does work already, only that he that holds,
let him hold now, until it be Job. 15. d Esa. ^1. a Dan. 8. d
whom the LORD Jesus, shall slaye with the breath of his mouth, and shall
destroy with the appearaunce of his coming, him, whose coming is Ioh. 8. d
after the workyng of Satanas, Deuteronomy. 13. a Mat. 24. b
in all power, and tokens, and lyenge wonders, and in all deceatfulnesse of
wickedness unto them that perysh, because they have not received ye love of
the truth yt they may be saved. ^acha. 5. a Roma. 1. d
Therefore shall God send them the workynge of error, that they may believe
the lie, that al they may be judged, that have not believed the truth but Ose^.
7. a
have agreed unto wickedness. But we ought to give God thanks always for you
brethren beloved of God, that God has chosen you the first fruits unto
salvation, in ye sanctificacion of the sprete, and in the faith of truth: Unto
the which he has chosen you also through our Gospel, unto the purchasing of
the glory of our LORD Jesus Christ Therefore brethren stand ye fast, and keep
the traditions that ye have learned, either by our preaching, or by our
epistle. But the same Jesus Christ our LORD, and our God and father, which
has loved us, and has given [vs] everlasting comfort and a good hope in
grace, exhort your hearts, and stablyshe them in every good work and word.

The.iii. Chapter.
FArthermore brethren Math. 9. ^ Ephesians. 6. c. Coll. 4. ^
pray Ioh. 6. ^.
for faith is not every man's. But the LORD is faithful, which shall stablyshe

Deuteronomy. 29. ^. and.30. b Iere. 24. b.

But we brethren do warn you in ye name of our LORD Jesus Christ, that ye do
wythdraw yourselues from every brother walkyng inordinatly, and not according
to the ordinance the which they have received us. 1. Cor. 4. ^
For ye yourselues do know how ye ought to follow us, for we were not
restless among you, another did we eat the bread of any man for naught: Act.
18. a. and.20. e. 2. Cor. 11. d 1. Tess. 2. a.
but labouryng night and day in weerynesse, lest we should charge any man. Not
as though we had had 1. Tess. 4. b.
But to the^ yt are such we command and beseke in the LORD Jesus, yt they
labourynge do eat their own bread. But brethren Gal. 6. a ^. Ioh. 1. b
do not ye faynte doing well. If there be any yt does not obey our word* show
[vs] ye same by a letter, and have no conversation with him, that he may be
ashamed and count him not as an enemy, but warn him as a brother. The very
God of peace give you everlasting peace in every place. The LORD be with you
all. Coll. 4. b
The salutacion with mine own hand Paul, which is the token in every
epistle, so do I write. Philip. 4. c 1. Tess. 5. c
The grace of our LORD Jesus Christ be with you all. AMEN.

The first Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothe.
The first Chapter.

our hope, Act. 16. a.

I did pray y^ that you should remain at Ephesus Act. 19.20.

preach none otherwise, 2. Tim. 2. c
another should give head unto fables and genealogies that are endelesse which
do rather move questions, Tit. 3. b.
than edifyenge to Godwarde, which is by faith. Romans 1^. b Galat. 6. ^.
For the end of faith is charity in Act. 15. b.
a pure heart, and a good conscience, and faith unfeigned. From ye which some
errynge, they are turned unto vain ianglinge, wyllinge to be teachers of the
law, not understanding another the things that are spoken, nor whereof they
affirm. Romans 7. b.
But we know Gal. 5. c
that the law Romans 1. ^.
the misusing themselves with mankind, to menstealers, to liars and for
